loans.name: Bolivia Group

texts.es: EL GRUPO "BOLIVIA" ESTA REPRESENTADO POR LA SEÑORA EUSEBIA ESTA CONFORMADA POR 17 SOCIOS (AS) LAS CUALES SON MUY TRABAJADORAS, ELLOS ( AS) SE DEDICAN AL COMERCIO D. KEROSENE, GASOLINA Y DIESEL, VENTA D. OLLAS, D. POLLERAS, VENTA D. COMIDA, VENTA D. JOYAS, COSTURA D. CHAMARRAS, VENTA D. CAMAS Y PILAS AL POR MAYOR . EN EL CASO D. DON LINO QUE ES EL ÚNICO VARÓN DEL GRUPO SE DEDICA A LA CONSTRUCCIÓN D. VIVIENDAS Y TAMBIÉN VEND. EN LA FERIA D. LA 16 D. JULIO REPUESTOS D. AUTOS. EN EL MERCADO DOND. TRABAJAN LAS SOCIAS EXISTE BASTANTE COMPETENCIA; A PESAR D. ELLO LAS SOCIAS SE VALEN D. LA RAPIDEZ QUE TIENEN PARA CAMBIAR Y SURTIR SU MERCADERÍA D. ACUERDO A LAS ÉPOCAS. EL DESTINO DEL CRÉDITO ES PRINCIPALMENTE EL INCREMENTO D. SU CAPITAL D. TRABAJO Y PARA LA COMPRA D. INSUMOS Y MATERIALES PARA DESEMPEÑAR SUS ACTIVIDADES. LA MAYORÍA D. LOS SOCIOS TIENEN EXPERIENCIA CREDITICIA PUESTO QUE NO ES SU PRIMER CICLO CON LA FUNDACIÓN AGROCAPITAL EN LA CUAL DEMOSTRARON RESPONSABILIDAD Y COMPROMISO CON LA INSTITUCIÓN.
texts.en:
The “Bolivia” Group is represented by Eusebia. It is comprised of 17 members, who are very hard workers. They sell kerosene, gasoline, and diesel fuel, the sale of pots, skirts, food, jewelry, making jackets, and selling beds and batteries. In the case of Don Lino, who is the only man in the group, he builds housing and also sells auto parts in the Fair of July 16th. In the market where the members work, there is a good deal of competition. In spite of that, the members value the speed that they have to change and supply their merchandise in accordance with the demands of a given time period. This credit is destined principally for the increase of working capital, for buying foods, and for buying materials to expand their activities. The majority of the members have experience with loans, given that this is not their first time working with Fundación Agrocapital in which they demonstrated responsibility and got along with the institution.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for business operation.

loans.name: Amuda

texts.en: Amuda is 51 years old and married with 3 children. She lives in Ogbomosho, Oyo state, Nigeria. She sells provisions and foodstuffs. She hopes to expand her business and increase her profits. She needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: C. is 53 years old and a resident of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She is a widow mother who has four children: the first one is married and lives separately, the second one runs a business as a local medical provider, and the other two attend school. C. currently is an assistant of the village consultant. C. has been facing difficulty with transportation for along time, she frequently hired the neighbor's taxi to work. Right now, she wants to reduce the cost of transportation; thus, she is asking for a loan to buy a used motorbike for riding to work and the family needs.

loans.use: To buy a used motorbike

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary E. is 36 years old and married with four children. She sells provisions and foodstuffs to people in her community. The demand for her provisions and foodstuffs is high and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more provisions and foodstuffs  to sell. She is indeed grateful to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Osim

texts.ru: Осим мужчина , который торгует на рынке города Худжанда, под названием "Бадри Мунир".За товаром он ездит сам , в Бишкек.Осим каждый свой займ использует для завоза сезонного товара.Он уже кредитуется третий год.его погашения проходят вовремя без нарушений.Мы рады работать с такими клиентами.
texts.en:
Osim is a man who has a business called "Badri Munir" at the Khujand city market. He goes himself to Bishkek for his products. Osim uses each loan he receives for delivery of that season's products. This is the third year he has taken out a loan, and he has made his payments on time without any problem. We are happy to work with such clients.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Shoe sales

loans.name: Mrs. Samorn Ean Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eighteen people living in Roteang village in Kandal province comprise this village bank loan and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Samorn E. is a 23 year-old village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Y. Ratha, is a fisherman who catches fish to sell for an income.

Although Mrs. Samorn E. and her husband try to work hard, they still earn less income to support the family. Additionally, they have difficulty to live at night because they do not have enough money to use electricity and to buy a battery to light the house.

In order to light the house, Mrs. Samorn E. decided to ask for a loan to buy a battery for her family to use in the house. Mrs. Samorn E. is 23 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study. Mr. Sokhoeun N. does not come to take a loan but his wife does, so she is presented in the picture instead.

loans.use: To buy a battery for her family to use in the house.

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda D. S. is a resident of Barangay San Lorenzo Ilagan, Isabela. She is already a widow and has four children. Her children aren’t able to pursue college due to financial difficulties. Her eldest child is Beth, who is now 30 years old and is already married. Her second child is Maricel, who is 27 years old. Her child third is Marlon, who is 26 years old, and her fourth child is Rowel.

Emelda is engaged in a hog-raising business and is maintaining a vending business at school, which she runs during classes in her village since the school building is near her house. Emelda would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 6,000 to fund additional working capital for her hog-raising business. She hopes that her business will grow and become a good source of income for her family. Now that her husband has passed away and her children are all married, Imelda has no one to depend on but herself alone. She believes in the saying, “Try and try until you succeed.”

loans.use: Fund working capital for hog-raising business

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia A. is thirty-six years old. She is a divorced mother of three children – one daughter and two sons. According to her, they are in junior high and primary school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Suhum in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Afia is a food vendor. She cooks and sells rice with stew. She prepares the food in her house and sells on a table top by the roadside. She sells from morning till evening. Afia buys bags of rice and other ingredients from the community market. Afia has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She is hopeful to send all her children through school.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice, etc. in bulk

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan G. is from the village of Pinig, Dumalinao. She is 32 years old. Susan is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Susan operates a gardening business. Susan has been engaged in her business for years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Susan joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Susan has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Susan is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Susan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business.

loans.name: Dinora Jeaqueline

texts.es:
la sra. Dinora C. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, ella tiene una pulperia que esta ubicada en su casa de habitacion la cual opera bajo el nombre de Pulperia DANIA, ella tiene 3 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, sus clientes la prefieren a ella por el tipo de atencion que les brinda.
es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos, con las ganancias que ella obtiene cubre con todos los gastos del hogar y de sus hijos.
ella nos comento que se siente muy alegre ya que todo le esta saliendo bien en su vida, en estos momentos ella desea comprar mas mercaderia para su negocio y asi poder aumentar las ganancias.
texts.en:
Mrs.Dinora C. is dedicated to the sale of popular consumer goods. She has a convenience store that is located in her house which operates under the name of DANIA convenience store. She has dedicated herself to this type of activity for three years; her customers prefer her for the attention she provides them. She is a single mother with 2 children, with the money she earns she covers household costs and the needs of her children. She says that she feels very happy because everything is going well in her life, now she wants to buy more merchandise for her business and thus increase her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sugar, rice, soap, toilet paper, coffee, drinks, bread, cookies, juices, eggs, chicken, ground corn, cheese, butter, churros (fried dough), candy, milk

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou N. est une dame de 57 ans, mariée et mère de 9 enfants. Elle s’active dans la vente de produits cosmétiques. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer son activité afin de mieux améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Fatou N. is a 57-year-old married mother of 9 children. She sells cosmetics. She is asking for this loan to strengthen her business in order to improve her family’s quality of life.

Translated from French by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Union Cascada Group

texts.es: La asociación comunal “Unión Cascada” es parte del centro focal Cascada, trabajan  junto  a Pro-Mujer hace diez años,  su presidenta es  Paula L.,  ella es una de las fundadoras , ha formado el grupo en sus inicios con familiares, vecinas de su barrio y amigas. Diversas son las actividades de este grupo, como ser; costura de ropa, trenzado de mantas, tejido de mantas artesanales, otras son comerciantes de verdura, fruta, víveres y cereales entre otros. Esta asociación desea comprar mercadería para ampliar sus ventas, de este modo generaran mayores ganancias y por lo tanto mejores ingresos para el bienestar de sus familias.
texts.en:
The community group “Unión Cascada” is part of the Cascada focal group. They have worked together with Pro-Mujer for ten years. Their president, Paula L. who is one of the founders, first formed the group with her family members, neighbours and friends. The group's activities are very diverse, such as; sewing clothing, weaving blankets, sewing handcrafted blankets. Others sell vegetables, fruit, general provisions and cereals, among other things. This association wishes to buy merchandise to increase their sales, and in this way generate higher earnings and therefore better incomes for the wellbeing of their families.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise/COMPRA DE MERCADERIA

loans.name: Akouvi Elom

texts.fr: Madame Akouvi habite le quartier de Bè-Kpota à Lomé. Elle est mariée à un jeune conducteur de taxi-moto. Le couple a un enfant à leur charge. C’est difficilement que son mari arrive à subvenir aux besoins de la famille. C’est pour apporter son aide financière à son mari que cette dame a pris la décision en 2002 de se lancer dans la vente de certains condiments de cuisine. Elle exerce son activité dans le marché très fréquenté de Bè-Kpota à Lomé. Actuellement elle a besoin de renouveler son stock ; elle sollicite donc un crédit de WAGES pour acheter au Grand Marché de Lomé 30 paniers de tomates naturelles, 03 grands sacs de gingembres, 15 sacs de piments verts. Ce prêt lui permettra aussi d’acheter 05 sacs de maïs et 03 sacs d’oignons.
texts.en:
Madame E. lives in the Bè-Kpota neighborhood in Lomé. She is married to a young motorcycle taxi driver and they have one child. Madame E.'s husband has difficulty providing for the family, so to help him with the finances, she decided to start up a business in 2002 selling cooking condiments. She conducts her business activity in the very busy Bè-Kpota market in Lomé. She currently needs to replenish her inventory, so she is requesting a loan from Kiva Field Partner, WAGES, to buy 30 baskets of natural tomatoes, three large sacks of stem ginger and 15 sacks of green peppers from the Big Market in Lomé. This loan will also allow her to buy five sacks of corn and three sacks of onions.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy natural tomatoes, peppers, ginger, onions and sacks of corn.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella operates a general store business for ten years situated in their village in Barangcuag, Angadanan, Isabela. She is 48 years old and managing her store is her way of helping her husband to generate income to meet the needs of their family.  Aside from her store, they also have a farm as their major source of income. 

Her desire to expand her business motivates her to seek for financial assistance from the KIVA lenders a loan PHP17, 000 to make her store productive.  

Estrella is married to Canuto, a farmer and they were blessed with three children: the eldest daughter is already a fourth year college student; the second is a third year college student, and their youngest child is an IT graduate. Estrella is doing her best to improve her store and praying for the success of her children too.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
Marta es una  mujer laboriosa de 42 años, tiene 4 hijos con los que vive en su casa. Desde niña se ha dedicado a la siembra de plátanos y rocoto; pero desde que formó su familia ingresó al rubro del comercio, a la compra y venta de rocotos y cayhuas, negocio que le ha resultado ser muy rentable. Ella envía sus productos a la capital de su región y a la ciudad de Lima y en un lapso de tres días sus compradores le envían el dinero a través de un banco. A Marta le gusta cuidar de sus cultivos y de su negocio, porque con esas ganancias cubre la educación de sus hijos y hasta les puede celebrar sus cumpleaños preparando la famosa pachamanca (comida hecha en un horno de piedras bajo tierra con 90 grados de temperatura), como se muestra en la foto, pues justamente la encontramos preparando este platillo.
Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, siendo una cliente muy puntual en sus pagos. Asimismo es muy activa en las actividades que organiza su banco comunal. Con el dinero que ahora solicita incrementará su capital de trabajo para la compra de más rocotos, ya que busca obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Marta is a hard-working woman, aged 42, and the mother of four children with whom she lives in her house. Since her childhood she grew bananas and hot peppers, but when she formed a family, she became a trader of hot peppers and cayhuas (local peppers), which resulted in a highly profitable undertaking. She ships her products to the capital city of her region and to Lima, and within three days her customers transfer the money through the banking system. Marta likes to take care of her crops and her business, because her income from it allows her to offer a good education to her children. Meanwhile, she can celebrate their birthdays preparing the famous pachamanca (food cooked in an underground stone oven at 90°C heat), which she was just doing when we met her, as shown in the picture.

This is her third loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, as she is always on time with her payments. She is also a very active participant in the activities organized by her communal bank. She will use the requested money to increase her working capital by purchasing more peppers, as she strives for a higher profit.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Emilyn

texts.en:
Emilyn is a 37-year-old businesswoman. She is married to Elizalde who works as a driver in their village. They have two children and both of them are currently in school. Their family lives happily and peacefully in the village of Maluno Sur, Benito Soliven, Isabela.

Emilyn and her loving husband operate a transportation business in their village. According to Emilyn, she needs funds for the maintenance of their business. She therefore requests a loan of PHP5,000 for the repair of their motorcycle. Their income from the business is a big help to their family. That’s why she prays that her loan will be granted.

loans.use: For the repair and maintenance of their passenger motorcycle

loans.name: Luis David

texts.es:
Luís, trabaja en una oficina como mensajero y estudia en el instituto bancario, es independiente y el único que genera ingresos pasa solventar sus gastos.
Vive en la zona de Chasquipampa  de la Ciudad de La Paz, en casa de sus padres.
El crédito será destinado para capital de Inversión ( pago de mensualidades y matricula en el instituto bancario, y así mejorar sus condiciones laborales). 
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en IMPRO.
texts.en:
Luís works in an office as a courier and studies in a banking institute. He is independent and pays his bills from his own income. He lives with his parents in the Chasquipampa zone in the city of La Paz. The loan he is applying for will be used for investment capital (to cover monthly payments and banking institute fees, which is how he will improve his working conditions). This is the first time he is requesting a loan with IMPRO.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment capital

loans.name: Nyamjav

texts.en:
Nyamjav is 54 years old and lives with his wife and three children in the Arhangai province of Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His daughter, 20, attends university and his two sons, 11 and 10, both attend a local secondary school. Nyamjav makes and sells wooden products in his town. He began his business in 1989 with working capital of 50,000 tugrugs (~35 USD). As he reaches his 20th year in business, his working capital now exceeds 600,000 tugrugs (~420 USD). He has gained not only business experience during his 20 years in service, but he has also gained more advanced carpentry skills. Nyamjav’s customers know that he makes quality, beautiful products and they know that he is a trustworthy, conscientious business owner. He says, “I want to expand my business and be able to afford my children’s education.” He is requesting an 800,000 tugrug loan in order to purchase more wood for his business so that he can keep growing his business in the future. About XacBank: XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.
To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.
To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase more wood for his business

loans.name: Greg

texts.en: Greg V. is from the village of Macabayao. He is 34 years old and is single. Greg owns and operates a dried-fish vending business in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Greg joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be his first from PMPC. Greg plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Bazarragchaa

texts.en: S. Bazarragchaa is 34 years old and lives with his wife and two young daughters in Khar-khorin, the captial city of the ancient Mongolian empire. They live together in a traditional Mongolian housing tent called a "ger." His oldest daughter is 6 years old and recently started kindergarten. His wife is currently unemployed and stays at home to look after their youngest daughter. Bazrragchaa operates a wooden products and jewelry-making business in his town. He started his businesses in 1997 and has built a stable operation over the years. Currently his jewelry sales bring in the most profit, and he plans to soon stop makng wood crafts and focus on jewelry full-time. Bazarragchaa has become an experienced jewelry maker over the years and always works hard to grow his business. He says, "I am conducting my business in order support my two daughters." He is requesting a 300,000 tugrug loan to purchase raw materials and tools used in jewelry making.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials

loans.name: Pan

texts.en:
Mr. Pan T. and his wife, Mrs. Nary Toun, live along National Road Number One, about thirty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1983 and have seven children: six sons and one daughter. One of their children is married and lives outside the family home, one son is an electrician, a daughter works for a factory that produces shoes, and the others attend school.

Pan is a wooden-house builder and his wife is a rice farmer. He is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: F. Micheline

texts.fr: F. F. Micheline est née le 20 Juin 1985 à Abomey-Calavi au Bénin. Il y a 6 ans que Micheline vit à Hlacomey à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Micheline n’est pas encore mariée et n’a pas encore d’enfant. Micheline vit donc seule et supporte seule ses charges, grâce au revenu que lui génère son activité. Micheline excelle dans la commercialisation des produits vivriers, surtout le haricot, au marché DANTOKPA, marché international du Bénin. C’est à Ikpinlè et à Kétou, deux marchés de vente de produits vivriers au Bénin, que Micheline  s’approvisionne. Micheline  a déjà trois ans d’expérience dans ce domaine, mais n’avait jamais eu de prêt à ALIDé. Très sollicitée par les détaillants des petits marchés de la ville, et par ses autres clients, Micheline ambitionne agrandir son étalage afin de faire face à la demande sans cesse croissante. C’est la raison pour laquelle Micheline sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
F. F. Micheline was born on June 20, 1985 in Abomey-Calavi in Bénin. For 6 years, Micheline has been living in Hlacomey in Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin. Micheline is not yet married and has no children as yet. She lives alone and supports herself thanks to income from her business.

Micheline excels in selling foodstuffs, especially dried beans, at the Dantokpa market, the international market of Bénin. She gets her inventory in Ikpinlè and Kétou, two foodstuffs markets in Bénin. She has been in this business for three years already, but has not yet had a loan from ALIDé. Very much in demand among the retailers at the small markets of the town, as well as among her other customers, Micheline dreams of expanding her display so as to keep up with growing demand; this is why she is requesting her first loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of sacks of dried beans

loans.name: Samarkul's Group

texts.en:
Samarkul K.'s background is very rich in experience. After successfully graduating from one of the prestigious universities of the Soviet Union, Kyrgyz National University, she worked as an accountant for more years than she could have imagined that she would. She was suddenly let go in 2004. The way she displayed courage was something unimaginable. Because an ambitious mind wants success, she was able to confront that situation. Thanks to God, she had studied well, because she started a little business which soon turned into big one. 

For 8,000 KGS ($178) she bought a cow. Selling milk didn't contribute enough to the family's budget, so they borrowed money from relatives to buy livestock. They bought bull calves, so that after fattening them they could sell them. Her revenue was about 500 KGS ($12). In the meantime, life went on and now she is fifty-four years old. She has married and has a brilliant husband who works as a teacher. In his free time he helps her with her business. Also she has two children; a daughter and a son. Her daughter is already married and now lives separately, and her son is a student. She is planning to increase the number of calves and provide education for her son as well. She wants a loan to buy bull calves for reselling after fattening. 

Gulzada K. is thirty-eight years old and is married. Her husband takes across passengers. They have six children, the elder one studying in the university, the rest attending local schools.  Ten years ago she successfully opened up a business by selling their bull calf for 20,000 KGS ($445). She sells housewares. Her revenue per month is about 15,000 KGS ($334). They already have bought a house, and have built a shop and a shed. She wants a loan to buy more housewares to sell.

Orozkul H. is a married woman. She is twenty-six years old and has two children who are at home with her. Her husband works on projects sometimes and also resells sheep in the farmyard. Three years ago they started their business with 5,000 KGS ($112) and now their profit per month is about 3,000 KGS ($65). They are planning to get a loan for reselling sheep.

Ulanbek B. is a 22-year-old energetic guy who is planning to build a barn, set up new fencing and increase the number of his livestock. His grandfather started this business ten years ago, but unfortunately he passed and the business was inherited. Now they are dealing with selling milk and cattle raising.  Their total revenue is about 3,000 KGS ($65) and they want to take out a loan to buy a bull calf to keep.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to buy bull calves to resell after fattening

loans.name: Jowey

texts.en: Jowey P., 27, is a fisherman who owns a small boat. His income goes to help support his family. He is requesting a loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. to buy fishing trap and fish net.

loans.use: to buy fishing trap and fishing net

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es:
El Sr. Juan Bautista es casado, tiene 5 hijos, los dos mayores están en los Estados Unidos teniendo a su cargo solamente 3 los cuales están en edad escolar, él se dedica al servicio de transporte, es dueño de una unidad de bus el cual se lo alquila al Ingenio San Antonio haciendo el recorrido de trabajadores desde hace 25 años.
Juan Bautista trabaja con Ceprodel desde el año 2007 y hasta la fecha se le han otorgado 3 créditos los cuales han sido para el mantenimiento del vehículo y este ultimo para compra de llantas.
texts.en:
Juan Bautista is married and has five children. The two oldest are in the United States and the remaining three are in school. Juan is in the transport business. He owns a bus that he rents to the Ingenio San Antonio sugar company for transporting workers. He has been doing this for 25 years. Juan has worked with Ceprodel since 2007 and in that time has been granted three loans. The first two were used for vehicle maintenance and this last one for the purchase of tires.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tires

loans.name: Olga Leticia

texts.es: La señora Olga Leticia E. es casada y es una joven mama de un pequeñito. Ella labora para una empresa de comida rápida reconocida a nivel nacional en el departamento de cocina, y su esposo labora para una empresa desde hace 2 años,están tramitando este crédito para los acabados exteriores de su casa, ya que hace pocos meses terminaron la construcción de su barda y desean darle un mejor acabado.
texts.en:
Olga Leticia E. is a young mother of one small son. She works for a national fast food company in the kitchen. Her husband has been working for a company for two years. They are seeking a loan to finish the exterior of their house. It has been a few months since the exterior wall was built and they would like a better finish on it.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish the exterior of their house

loans.name: Sokhna

texts.fr: Sokhna S. est une femme de 43 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DNAKH S. depuis 07 ans et demi et a eu 15 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit qu'elle a toujours bien géré et remboursé à temps. Elle fait de l'embouche ovine, elle va acheter 10 béliers qu'elle va engraisser et revendre au bout de 5 mois. Elle participe financièrement à la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Sokhna S. is a 43-year old woman who is married and mother to three children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois in DNAKH S. for seven and half years and has benefited from 15 consecutive loans, which she has always managed well and repaid on time. She has a sheep fattening business and she is going to buy 10 rams which she will fatten up and resell after five months. She contributes financially to the family expesnes.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Develop and promote her fattening business

loans.name: María Concepción

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE”; Nuestra socia vive en la ciudad del Cusco, en el distrito de Huanchac departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la  Sra. MARIA,  ella tiene 48 años de edad es casada y tiene 3 hijos Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con gobierno regional, la socia es funcionaría pública y trabaja desde hace 29 años; Nuestra socia tiene una hija que es ingeniero civil su hija trabaja haciendo proyectos de construcción en el campo a 8 horas del Cusco en santo tomas chumbivilcas, la socia solicita el préstamo para su hija que desea invertir en sus estudios previos a este su nuevo proyecto en el área rural, Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para darle a su hija para que ella haga los primeros estudios básicaos de su proyecto en la zona rural.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the “Comuzone” Communal Bank. She lives in the District of Huanchac in the city of Cusco, Department of Cusco.

Maria is 48 years old, married, and has three children. She divides her time between her household activities and her job working for the regional government. Maria has worked as a civil servant for 29 years. She has a daughter who is a civil engineer and works in the field on construction projects in Santo Tomas Chumbivilcas, which is located eight hours away from Cusco. Maria is requesting a loan for her daughter so that she can invest in continuing education classes that will allow her to work on new projects in rural areas. The loan will be used to pay for her first basic courses in rural projects.

Maria appreciates and values the support that has been provided. Therefore, she promises to complete her loan payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for her daughter's continuing education courses in engineering

loans.name: Remberto

texts.es: EL SR. REMBERTO VIVE EN LA LOCALIDAD DE EL TORNO EN EL BARRIO 6 DE MAYO, EN LA CASA DE SU PADRE, SU ACTIVIDAD ES LA DE ALBAÑIL, SU ESPOSA CON LA CUAL TIENE 1 HIJO, ELLA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE JUGO DE FRUTAS EN EL MERCADO CENTRAL EL TORNO, EL DESTINO DEL CREDITO ES PARA AMPLIAR SU NEGOCIO DE VENTA DE JUGO, LA CUAL LE GENERA UN INGRESO EXTRA PARA MANTENER A SU FAMILIA, SE SIENTEN AGRADECIDO CON LA INSTITUCION POR HABERLE BRINDADO EL APOYO ECONOMICO PARA FORTALECER SU CAPITAL QUE POR TANTOS AÑOS HAN REUNIDO, Y ASI DARLE LA COMODIDAD A SU FAMILIA.
texts.en:
Sr. Remberto lives at his father’s house in the May 6th neighborhood of the town of El Torno. He is a bricklayer by profession. His wife sells fruit juices at the central market in El Torno. They have one son.

This loan will be used to expand his wife’s juice business so that she can generate additional income to help support their family. He is grateful to Emprender for providing the assistance to strengthen the financial capital that he spent many years to acquire so that he can make life easier for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand his wife's juice business

loans.name: Metas Triunfantes Group

texts.es: ANA CRISTINA MAYORGA ES LA REPRESENTANTE DEL GRUPO SOLIDARIO LLAMADO METAS TRIUNFANTES.    ELLA INICIA VENDIENDO PRODUCTO POR  CATALOGO PARA UNA SEÑORA, TIEMPO DESPUES YA LOGRA MANEJAR SU PROPIA MERCADERIA.  CON EL TIEMPO TAMBIEN VENDE BLUSAS DE  TELA.  SU COMPAÑERA MAYRA  VENDE LA ROPA Y CALZADO AMERICANO.  TAMBIEN JULIO CESAR QUIEN ES MIEMBRO DEL BANCO INICIO  SU NEGOCIO EN SU PROPIA CASA CON EL APOYO DE SU MAMA UNICAMENTE, ELLOS NO DEJAN DE SOÑAR CON UN NEGOCIO GRANDE PARA CUMPLIR SUS METAS Y TENER UNA FORMA DE VIDA MEJOR. POR ESO BUSCAN LA OPORTUNIDAD DE CAPITALIZAR SUS NEGOCIOS, POR ESO ES QUE ELLOS SOLICITAN ESTE CRÈDITO PARA PODER INVERTIR Y POCO A POCO HACER REALIDAD SUS SUEÑOS.
texts.en:
Ana Cristina Mayorga represents the Metas Triunfantes group. She started selling products for an employer through a catalogue, but she now handles her own merchandise and also sells wool blouses. Her friend Mayra sells American clothes and shoes. Julio Cesar started his business out of his own home with only the help of his mother, and they never stop dreaming of having a large business to achieve their goals and obtain a better lifestyle. For these reasons, they are all looking for opportunities to expand their businesses. For these reasons, they are requesting this loan in order to be able to invest and, little by little, make their dreams reality.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase shoes, sound equipment and television sets

loans.name: 08.1.1 Nam Ngan Group

texts.en:
Hanh N. T. (1) is a 50-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoa. Hanh is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 08.1.1 Nam Ngạn.

Hanh is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Hanh owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Hanh has been engaged in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2008, Hanh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hanh has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be the fourth loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hanh plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1. N. T. Hau (2) is a 51-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.

2. H. T. Son (3) is a 50-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making and selling food.

3. N. T. Hai (4) is a 52-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.

4. D. T. T. Hong (5) is a 26-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

5. N. T. Dong (6) is a 35-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Hanh N. T. (1) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  Hanh là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 08.1.1 Nam Ngạn (08.1.1 Nam Ngan).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các mặt hàng nhu yếu phẩm như dầu gội đầu, xà bông & kem đánh răng trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Hanh thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 7 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Hanh kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND.  Vào 2008, Hanh đã T. gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng T. gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Hanh đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  N. T. Hau (2) là 51 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


2.  H. T. Son (3) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


3.  N. T. Hai (4) là 52 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


4.  D. T. T. Hong (5) là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


5.  N. T. Dong (6) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  D. việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Elhadji Ibrahima

texts.fr: Monsieur Elhadji Ibrahima B. est un jeune peintre âgé de 25 ans et marié qui exerce des travaux de peintures murales dans la zone de Saly sur commande . Ainsi pour l'acquisition de nouveaux produits il sollicite ce prêt dans le but d'agrandir ses activités . L'artisanat étant une activité importante dans la cité touristique de Mbour Mr B. pourrait faire valoir ses talents d'artistes et générer des bénéfices qui lui permettront de faire face à ses dépenses quotidiennes
texts.en:
Mr. Elhadji Ibrahima B. is a young 25-year old artist, married, who paints commissioned murals in the area of Saly. He is requesting a loan to purchase new painting supplies and expand his activities. Crafts are an important activity in the tourist city of Mbour. Mr. B. plans to showcase his artistic talents and generate profits that would enable him to cover his daily expenses.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase paint

loans.name: God We Trust Group

texts.en:
Macia C., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called God We Trust. She is 37 years old, single and has three children who range from 6 to 14 years old.  She was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to a lack of financial support. 

For 8 years, she has been selling sugar, flour, palm oil and rice in Redlight Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 26,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more sugar, flour, palm oil and rice. She describes herself as a devoted mother.

Her goal is to improve her business, build a house and continue to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, flour, palm oil and rice.

loans.name: Maria Amable

texts.es:
María de 29 años, tiene una tienda de víveres en Paraíso de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y lomas), tiene un hijo de 11 años. 

Ella comenzó la tienda hace 6 años atrás para poder ayudar con los gastos familiares, comenzó a vender legumbres y vegetales poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo tener su tienda mas surtida hasta que con sus ahorros compro vitrinas, y pudo vender enlatados. Por esa buena decisión ahora ella trabaja desde las 08h00 hasta las 22h00pm todos los días. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar legumbres y arroz para su tienda, en el futuro quiere que su tienda sea una de las mas reconocidas en Guayaquil.
texts.en:
María, 29, has a grocery store in Paraíso de Guayaquil, a hilly periurban area with unpaved streets. She has an 11-year-old son. She opened her store 6 years ago in order to help with family expenses. She started out selling a few vegetables and gradually her efforts led to a better stocked store. She used savings to buy display cases and was able to sell canned goods. This good decision on her part has led to her being open daily from 8am until 10pm. She will use the funds to buy vegetables and rice for her store. In the future she’d like her store to be one of the better-known ones in Guayaquil.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For vegetables and rice.

loans.name: Eudalia

texts.es:
La señora Eudalia M. tiene ya más de dos años dedicándose ha la venta de ropa usada. Este negocio es la fuente de ingreso de ella y su hija quien actual mente esta estudiando. 
Al negocio le esta haciendo falta mas variedad de mercancía pero por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión, es por eso que solicita un préstamo y así tendrá más mercancía que vender. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias del negocio.
texts.en:
Eudalia M. has for already more than two years been selling second-hand clothing. This business is the source of income for her and her daughter who is currently studying. Her business needs a greater variety of stock but at the moment she does not have the money needed for this investment. This is why she is asking for a loan so that she will have more stock to sell. She plans to pay the loan from part of the business profits.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase stock for the business

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia S. is from the village of Tu-od, Manticao, Misamis Oriental. She is 40 years old. Lucia is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, she raises chickens for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately $250 a month for these activities.

In 2006, Lucia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby chicks to raise and sell in the future. 

Lucia is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her 8th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata”; El banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Yuncaypata, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Clotilde; ella tiene 43  años de edad y es casada  y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  negocio de venta de productos secos como habas, maíz, moraya, frijoles y trigo y su esposo trabaja como maestro de construcción y juntos sacan adelante a sus pequeños hijos, la socia quiere tener un lugar donde vender las verduras. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar  granos secos  al por mayor.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Clotilde, 43, is married and has four children. She is a member of the “Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata” communal bank located in Yuncaypata, Cusco province, Cusco department. She alternates her daily chores with the sale of dry grains like lima beans, corn, dehydrated potato, beans and wheat. Her husband is a master builder and together they support their young children. She would like to have a place to sell the vegetables. She is asking for funds to buy grains at wholesale. She makes use of this forum to thank all those who share in her dream and promises to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dry grains at wholesale.

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
Augusto asume el cargo D. presidente,D. la alcancia comunal “PRIMAVERA” conformada por  13 socios entusiastas y emprendedores, quienes realizan diversas actividades como: producción,  comercio y servicio, ellos vienen trabajando con EDAPROSPO- Prosperidad desD. hace 5 años.
Augusto tiene 53 años, casado, y tiene 2 hijos. DesD. hace 20 años se dedica a la venta D. pescado en el terminal pesquero, se inicio en este negocio porque inicialmente era ayudante D. una persona que vendía pescado, luego decidió independizarse, con el esfuerzo D. su trabajo ha logrado la construcción D. su vivienda, con el ingreso D. su negocio cubre los gastos D. alimentos y pago D. servicios, nos cuenta que su gran meta es ampliar mas su negocio.
El reciente préstamo será destinado a la compra D. mercadería, todos nuestros socios agradecen el apoyo brindado y se comprometen a pagar en los plazos pactados.
texts.en:
The “Primavera” (Springtime) Communal Bank is comprised of 13 enthusiastic and enterprising members.  They work at  different activities like production, commerce, and service.  They have been working with EDAPROSPO- Prosperidad for five years.

Augosto is the president.  He is 53 years old, married, and has two children.  He has been selling fish at the fishing terminal for 20 years.  He started this business because he used to be a helper to a person who sold fish, and Agosto decided to become independent.  Through his work efforts he has managed to build his house.  The income from his business covers the food expenses and pays for services.  He tells us that his big goal is to expand his business more.

The loan he is requesting is to buy merchandise.

All of the members are grateful for the support, and they pledge to make their payments on time.

loans.use: compra de mercadería

loans.name: Alima

texts.en: Alima is 32 years old, married, and has three children who are 17, six and three years old.  She also supports two other dependents, and is paying for their education. In 2003, she established a business selling soft drinks and other beverages, soap and water. She began her business because she wanted to contribute to her family's income, and now works seven days a week, 11 hours a day. She has applied for a loan to buy more drinks to sell to her customers, and hopes to use the additional income made possible by this loan to pay for her children's schooling and open a savings account. She expresses her sincerest thanks to Kiva lenders who choose to support her by funding this loan.

loans.use: To buy more beverages to sell to her customers

loans.name: Altansuvd

texts.en:
Altansuvd D., age 39, operates a retail food business. She cooks the food in the family’s "ger" (the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent in which the family lives) and delivers it all over town to markets and office buildings. She started her business earlier this year based on her experience working in a cafe as an assistant worker. She tells us, "All I want is to provide a good education for my three children." 

She is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to buy food supplies for her business and to pay her children's tuition fees of 250,000 MNT.
 
Altansuvd lives with her husband and three children, ages 12, 17, and 20, in the Suhbaatar province of Mongolia. During the winter months, she and her family live in a "ger," and during the summer months, they live in a government house. Her husband works as a road repairer.

loans.use: To buy food supplies for her business and to pay her children's tuition fees

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is 40 years old, married, and father of four, aged between 6 and 16 years, with three attending school.  He has been a mixed farmer for fifteen years.  He sells millet, maize, beans, tea, coffee and milk locally.

He has requested this loan of Kshs. 45,000 to buy a dairy cow. Proceeds from this loan will be used to feed the family. In five years he hopes to start a retail shop in Kenyenya market and have five good dairy cows.

The challenge he faces is lack of enough capital to enable him to run his farming business.  He is however thankful to Juhudi for the loan.

loans.use: buy a cow

loans.name: Kurmanbubu's Group

texts.en:
Kurmanbubu A. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Kochkor, a small town in Isykul region. Kurmanbubu is 56 and married. She has four sons and a daughter. All of them are married and live separately with their families. The sons work in construction and the daughter works at the airport. Twenty years ago, with the initial investment of 3,000 soms, Kurmanbubu started to take orders and sew Kyrgyz national blankets, cloth and dressmaking supplies. In this way, she earns 10,000 soms per month. Kurmanbubu applied for a loan because she needs money to purchase wool and paint for sewing. In the future, she wants to expand her business and start building a house for her children.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase paint and wool

loans.name: Myagmarsuren

texts.en: Myagmarsuren D. is 33 years old and lives with her husband and two children in an apartment Tuv province in central Mongolia. Her oldest daughter attends a local secondary school. Her husband operates an international cargo service between Korea and Mongolia. Myagmarsuren used to work as a programmer in the health agency between 2000-2006 after graduating from agriculture university in 1998. In 2009, she and her husband both went to Korea to work there in order to make more money. After returning to Mongolia in 2010, her savings earnings have enabled her to purchase an apartment and a new car for her family. She currently operates a clothes and cellphone trading business in her town. She started her clothing business in August, 2010 by selling a variety of clothing items and cellphones and its parts in the local trade center. Myagmarsuren plans to expand her business by offering computer related services to her customers. In order to operate this business, she needs to purchase and place a computer, camera and printer next to her stall at the local market. For the future, she hopes to continue to grow her business and open her own trade center with her business profits. She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase computer, canon and printer in order to start providing new services.

loans.use: To purchase a computer, a camera and printer

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” CHIKON”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Victoria; ella tiene 46 años de edad, casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia se dedica a la compra y venta de menestras como lentejas, frejoles entre otros, la socia luego lo distribuye a sus clientes de forma ambulatoria y personas que también le solicitan a la vez también tiene su negocio de tienda de abarrotes donde vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar y leche siendo esta la forma de sacar a su familia adelante.  

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de productos para sus negocios.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en: The member belongs to the Chikon Community Bank. The bank is located in the Urubamba district, belonging to the Urubamba province in the department of Cusco. The member is Mrs. Victoria. She is 46, married and has 3 children. She buys and sells mixed vegetables such as lentils and beans, among others. She later distributes to her customers on foot. She also has a grocery store business where she sells basic staples such as rice, sugar and milk. This is how she gets her family ahead. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of products for her businesses. She is happy to have this loan and promises to honour the payments of her quotas.

loans.use: She is requesting this loan for the purchase of products for her businesses.

loans.name: God Bless Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “God Bless” group. They are small businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Isatu B.. Isatu is thirty-six years old.  She was born in Kamakwe, a town in northern Sierra Leone.  Currently, she resides in Makeni city with her husband and three children. Her husband is a soldier.  Two of her children are attending primary school and the youngest is not yet of school-going age. 

For the past three years, Isatu has been selling palm oil in gallons and pints. With her share of this loan, she will buy palm oil at wholesale to add to her business.

loans.use: Buys palm oil at wholesale

loans.name: María Estela

texts.es:
La Sra. Estela vive en la ciudad de Carapeguá, es propietaria de una librería en el centro mismo de la ciudad, es viuda y tiene dos hijas mayores que ya no viven con ella y son profesionales.
Solicita el crédito para compra de útiles escolares ya que se aproximan las clases y debe comprar este mes; y si realiza la compra al por mayor consigue mejores descuentos y aumenta su margen de ganancia.
La cliente opera con Fundación Paraguaya desde el año 2005 y cuenta con buen historial de crédito.
texts.en:
Estela lives in the city of Carapeguá.  She is the proprietor of a bookstore in the center of the city.  She is a widow, and she has two adult daughters.  They do not live with her now; they are professionals.

She is requesting the loan to buy school supplies.  Class will start soon, and she needs to buy the supplies this month.  If she makes the purchase wholesale, she will get better discounts and increase her profit margin.

She has worked with the Fundación Paraguaya since 2005, and she has a good credit history.

loans.use: To buy school supplies

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth Y. is from the village of Imelda, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 57 years old. Bernadeth is married and has three children. To make a living, Bernadeth owns & operates a tailoring business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing general  alteration & tailoring services to local community members. Bernadeth has been engaged in her business for over 40 years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Bernadeth joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bernadeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Bernadeth is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Bernadeth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam J. is a 55-year-old lady. She is married to Washington and they are both farmers. Miriam practices poultry farming and has been in this business for the last year. 

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, and she plans to purchase more chicks to rear and sell later at a profit. The anticipated profits will be used to buy a cow. Miriam hopes to grow her business and eventually to own a large poultry farm.

loans.use: purchase more chicks to rear and sell later at a profit.

loans.name: Ofelia Maribel

texts.es:
Doña Ofelia, tiene 43 años de edad, reside en San Jorge departamento de San Miguel, es madre soltera, pero vive sola porque sus hijos están en sus propios hogares, ella se dedica a vender agua y jugos, este negocio lo inicio hace 10 años, aprendió por iniciativa propia, sus clientes son personas que llegan al pueblo y amistades que circulan por la zona, trabaja todos los días de 7:00am a 4:00pm.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de frutas para preparar los jugos y también agua en bolsas para vender, esto contribuirá a mantener el negocio y a contar con lo suficiente en productos para la elaboración de jugos, obteniendo siempre ganancias que cubran los gastos diarios de doña Ofelia.
Su objetivo es mantenerse y continuar con el negocio, para un día poder ahorrar lo suficiente para tener su terreno y construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
43 year-old Ofelia lives in San Jorge, in San Miguel department.  She is a single mother but lives alone because her children all live in their own homes.  Ofelia's business is selling water and juice.  She started her business, which she learned through her own initiative, 10 years ago.  Her customers are people who come to the village and friends who are in the area.  She works every day from 7.00am to 4.00pm.

Ofelia is requesting a loan to buy fruit which she will use to prepare her juices.  She will also buy bags of water to sell.  This will help her to keep her business running and ensure she has enough products to make her juices, making enough profits to cover her daily expenses.

Ofelia's goal is to support herself and keep going in her business so that one day she will have saved up enough to buy a plot of land and build her own home.

loans.use: to buy fruit to make juice and also bags of water to sell

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.en: Hanifa is a thirty-seven-year-old married woman with six children, and she owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in a hotel business for three years, which she started with the capital of 800,000 UGX and now she has 1,500,000 UGX as working capital. Her hardship is high labor turnover and her vision is running a big hotel and educating her children. Hanifa needs the credit facility to buy furniture and a television set.

loans.use: to buy furniture and television set

loans.name: Mujeres Activas De Candia Loma Group

texts.es:
Dicho comité es de la compañía Candia Loma de la ciudad de Caacupe, que dista a aproximadamente 10 km de la oficina. Está compuesto por 16 mujeres muy trabajadoras y unidas.
La presidenta, la Sra. Petrona G. vive con su marido e hijos, posee una pequeña despensa en su domicilio, también gracias a el programa de microfranquicias de la Fundacion Paraguaya pudo acceder al kit de anteojos sin receta para la reventa y así generar más ingresos para el sustento de su hogar.
Todas ellas están muy agradecidas con la Fundación Paraguaya porque gracias al crédito que percibieron en etapas anteriores y a las constantes capacitaciones pueden generar sus propios ingresos y así ayudar y dar mejor calidad de vida a sus familiares.
La sra. Petrona desea poder adquirir este crédito para poder comprar ropas de invierno y vender a sus exigentes clientes, generando mayores ingresos para su canasta familiar.
texts.en:
This microfinance group is from the Candia Loma rural area of the city of Caacupe, which is approximately 10 km from the regional office. This group is comprised of 16 very hardworking and united women.

The group president, Ms. Petrona G., lives with her husband and children. She owns a small in-home general store. Also, thanks to Fundación Paraguaya's microfinance program, she has been able to obtain non-prescription reading glasses so that she can resell them, thus generating more income for the household expenses.

These women are all very grateful to Fundación Paraguaya because thanks to their previous loans and to the constant training sessions, they are able to generate their own income and help provide a better quality of life for their families.

Ms. Petrona wishes to obtain this loan to purchase winter clothing to sell to her demanding customers, thus generating more money for the household.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for winter.

loans.name: Jessika

texts.en: Jessika is currently in the business of selling charcoal. She is 41 years old and married with one child who does not go to school. Jessika requested a loan to stock more charcoal to sell. She hopes to expand in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha nació en Quillabamba (Cusco, Perú), tiene 40 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su pareja Isaac y su único hijo, quien es el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Los verdes campos de la comunidad de Chichubamba, ubicado en la Valle Sagrado de los Incas donde actualmente vive,  han sido en la vida de Martha un lugar muy agradable para trabajar. Desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron esta labor y ahora ella tiene sus propias tierras en las que trabaja junto a su pareja, que con mucho esmero siembran flores como por ejemplo rosas, crisantemos, claveles y otras flores. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que su arduo trabajo ha sido de mucho provecho. Lleva varios años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos hasta los centros de acopio situados en las ciudades de Urubamba y Cusco. Martha solicita el préstamo para realizar unos de sus planes, que es extender la siembra de flores, por ser una de sus plantas que mayor precio tiene en el mercado. Con el tiempo, espera juntar el dinero suficiente para abrir una maderera. Ella tiene la obligación de pagar sus aportes puntualmente y está dispuesta a hacerlo si desea acceder a otro crédito. Agradece a la institución por concederle el préstamo. Con los 1,200 nuevos soles, comprará semillas y así aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
Martha was born in Quillabamba (Cusco, Peru). She is 40 years old and she is a very happy and hardworking woman. She lives in a house which she owns together with her partner Isaac and their only son. He is the motivation for all of their efforts. The green fields of the community of Chichubamba, located in Valle Sagrado de los Incas, is where Martha currently lives and in life it has been a most pleasant place for her to work. 

When she was very young her parents taught her this business and today she has her own fields where she works together with her partner. With a great deal of care they cultivate flowers, such as roses, chrysanthemums, carnations, and other flowers. what she most enjoys about her work is to harvest the fields because this is when she feels that her arduous work has been a great investment. She has been in the business for several years and she considers the most difficult part to be the transportation of the harvest to the collection centers in the cities of Urubamba and Cusco. Martha requests a loan to carry out one of her plans, which is to extend her flower plantation because her plants obtain the best price in the market. With time she hopes to save enough money to start a lumber yard. She has the obligation to make her payments on time and she is ready to do so if she wants to have another loan. She is thankful to the organization for granting her this loan. With the 1200 nuevos soles she will purchase seeds to increase production.

loans.use: to purchase seeds to increase production.

loans.name: Zephaniah

texts.en:
Zephaniah is 30 years old, married, and the father of two.  He is able to provide for his family with the income from his electronics repair shop.  He repairs electronics such as TVs, radios and computers.  

He was previously employed and decided to go into business for himself because he needed to earn enough income to raise his family.  His desire is to expand his business.  

He has requested 30,000 KES to buy transistors, speakers, motherboards and TV kits.

loans.use: to buy transistors, speakers, motherboards and TV kits.

loans.name: Miguel Abdon

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 36 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con sólo servicio de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande, que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona la actividad que desarrollan es la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Miguel desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (ovejas) y aves de corral, su corral se encuentra en la parte externa de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y granos naturales, una vez que llegan a su crecimiento ideal los ofrece a los mismos pobladores de la zona o los vende en el mercado de Tambogrande, con los ingresos que obtenga solventará sus obligaciones familiares.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar más alimentos balanceados para tenerlos bien alimentados y así podrá ofrecerlos a un mejor precio a sus clientes para poder cubrir su crédito otorgado y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Miguel es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que sus  hijos tengan otras oportunidades de estudio.
texts.en:
Miguel, 36, lives with his wife and children in his own house which has electricity only.  It is located in the rural area of the district of Tambogrande which belongs to the department of Piura.  This area is active in agriculture, livestock farming and crafts.

For several years Miguel has been raising and selling sheep and chickens.  His farmyard is situated behind his house.  He gives the animals balanced feed and natural grains and once they are fully developed he sells them to other people living in the area or he takes them to market in Tambogrande.  He uses the earnings to take care of family expenses.

He has requested a loan in the amount of 1,000 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa to buy balanced feed for his animals' development so he can offer them at a better price to customers.  This will enable him to pay back the loan and improve his family's lifestyle.  Miguel is a hard-working, responsible person who only wants the best for his children and for them to get an education.

loans.use: To buy balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Luis Alcides

texts.es:
Luis, tiene un taller de estructuras metálicas, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 28 y 22 años de edad, los dos hijos aun son dependientes, pero el mayor le ayuda en el taller, su horario de trabajo es de 8:00am a 4:00pm. Este negocio surgió por iniciativa propia y su desventaja es que tiene épocas donde no se trabaja, ya que depende de la demanda de los clientes.
Actualmente necesita invertir en materiales para la elaboración de puertas y para la reparación de algunas herramientas, para elaborar puertas necesita lámina, hierro, las herramientas que utiliza son el compresor, el soldador y algunas llaves, este préstamo le permitirá una mayor rapidez para la entrega de los pedidos.
Para Luis su propósito es mantener en el taller todo lo necesario en materiales y herramientas en buen estado, pues estos son los medios para la ejecución de su trabajo, lo cual le permite tener los ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Luis, who has a metal-working workshop, lives with his wife and two sons who are 28 and 22 years old.  The two children are still dependent on him, but the eldest helps in the workshop.  His work schedule is from 8:00 am to 4:00 pm. This business grew from his own initiative, and its disadvantage is that he has times where he doesn't work because it all depends on customer demand.

Currently, he needs to invest in materials for the manufacturing of doors and for the repair of some tools.  To manufacture the doors, he needs metal sheets and iron.  The tools used are the compressor, welder and some keys.  This loan will allow for faster delivery of orders.

For Luis, his intent is to keep all the necessary materials and tools in the shop in good condition, because these are the means to carry out his work, which in turn gives him income for his family.

loans.use: to buy iron and metal sheets, repair the welder and compressor.

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila is a 44-year-old woman and a mother of six children. She owns a grocery store. She wants a loan of $3,000 to have a better income by increasing the variety of items she sells as grocery stores are in big numbers in the area where she lives. Laila's store is on a big shopping street and has a good chance of increasing the number of customers. Laila came to FATEN to take out the needed loan.

Laila is a conservative woman. Therefore, her husband is photographed instead in the store.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in the store

loans.name: Mey

texts.en:
Mr. Mey, 47, is the head of family, and lives in Dongkor Commune of Phnom Penh. Being responsible for a big family, he always decides how to earn more money in his family. He and his wife are interested in making a business as a chicken meat seller in one of the markets near the house. 

In helping the family in improvement, his wife works as hard as her husband everyday. As they both work harder, they can earn $6 per day. Additionally, they have four children, two of whom are working as sewing factory workers and another one is working as a garment factory worker in Phnom Penh.

He is asking for a loan to purchase a lot of chickens for selling.  He wishes to enlarge his current house, and to support his kids to finish their highest degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a lot of chickens for selling

loans.name: Fredis Armando

texts.es:
Fredis, es carpintero, vive con su familia, tiene 7 años de dedicarse a la fabricación de muebles, su horario de trabajo es de 7:00am a 5:00pm, el trabajo lo aprendió cuando trabajaba como empleado de una carpintería.
Por el momento necesita un préstamo que cubra el gasto de madera y pintura, los cuales son materiales necesarios para la fabricación,  esta compra le ayudara para fortalecer el taller y poder realizar los trabajos.
La aspiración de él es que su negocio se vuelva más fuerte, contar con más clientela, apoyar a su familia en los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Fredis is a carpenter and lives with his family. He has been making furniture for seven years. His work schedule is from 7:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. He learned his trade when he worked as an employee at a carpentry shop.

At the moment, he needs a loan to cover the expenses of wood and paint, which are necessary materials for his projects. This purchase will help Fredis to strengthen his workshop and to be able to complete his work.

His dreams are for his business to become stronger, to have more customers, and to support his family with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy wood from different trees and various paint colors

loans.name: Bahaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 29 years old, single and lives with five family members who all work.

Bahaa has been an owner of a store since 2008, selling and making pastries, sweets and juices. He has a good experience in this field and has a good reputation and he is becoming well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $2400 loan to renovate and fix his store’s ceiling, floor and walls and to make a showcase and to buy a split air conditioner. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: To renovate and fix his store’s ceiling, floor and walls and to make a showcase and to buy a split air conditioner.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 33 years old and has been engaged in the buying and selling of fruits and vegetables for five years.  She usually earns P700 within two market days which is not enough to provide for the needs of her family.  For additional income, she also entertains field work such as the harvesting of rice every harvesting season.

She wishes to improve her business by asking for a loan in the amount of P8,000 to buy bananas, eggplants, and string beans as additional goods to sell.
