texts.es: Ana Consuelo O. de 37 años de edad reside en el departamento de La Paz junto a sus cuatro hijos Cesar de 20 años, Maria de 16 años, Beatriz de 10 años y Nadia de 3 años de edad. Ana es madre soltera y ha logrado sacar adelante a su hijos brindándole estudios a todos ya que reconoce que la educación es parte importante para la formación de sus hijos, Ana tiene un negocio de venta de pupusas y bebidas donde el principal motor del día a día lo obtiene del deseo de superación que quiere darle a su familia es por eso que Ana solicita un crédito ya que desea surtir de mas bebidas y productos para su negocio asi lograra aumentar su ingresos por medio de sus ventas.
texts.en:
Ana Consuelo O. is 37 years old and lives in the department of La Paz with her four children. Cesar is 20 years old, Maria is 16 years old, Beatriz is 10 years old, and Nadia is 3 years old. Ana is a single mother and has succeeded in taking her children forward by offering all of them an education because she recognizes that education is an important part of her children’s development. Ana has a business where she sells maize dumplings and drinks. Her main motivation from day to day is her desire to be able to give more to her family. Because of this, Ana is requesting a loan so that she can supply more drinks and products for her business. With this, she will succeed in increasing her income through her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply her business

loans.name: Ma. Leslie

texts.en:
Ma. Leslie V. is a 40-year-old mother of four children and the wife of Jerry, a government employee. Despite the fact that Ma. Leslie’s husband earns a salary every month from the government, she has not tied herself to the role of being just a mother and a wife. She wanted to be an entrepreneur and augment her husband's income, especially with the increasing financial demand of the education of her children, two of whom are in college and the other two are in high school. 

To enhance he productive role being a woman, Ma. Leslie joined ASHI in 2006 with the knowledge of her husband. She then used her loan to start a food vending business. Ma. Leslie loves to cook. She can satisfy the appetites of her children the way she satisfies the appetites of her customers. Eventually, Ma. Leslie’s business grew and she had saved money from her profits. The amount of loan she is qualified to borrow from ASHI grew, too, so she was able to start another business. She then bought a tricycle -- a motorcycle with an attached sidecar – to use as a public utility vehicle.

Ma. Leslie’s present loan applied will be used for her food vending business and some portions will be spent for the renewal of her tricycle licenses and franchise.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food business. A small portion will be used for the tricycle maintenance.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 51 year old widow with six children, four sons and two daughters. Some of her children are still in school. As a single parent, Rose says she works very hard to be able to provide for the family. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Dunkwa in the Central region of Ghana.

Rose supplies cereals such as maize, beans, etc. to food vendors and other retailers in her community. She buys her goods all the way from Northern Ghana and has been in business for over thirty years. Rose would like a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business, as she aspires to give all her children good education.

loans.use: To buy cereals for her food supply business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Achat de bidons d'huile et de sacs d'oignons

loans.name: Munkhtogtokh

texts.en: Munkhtogtokh is 42 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Uyurkhangai province of Mongolia. The three oldest children attend high school, while the youngest child is at home.  Munkhtogtokh makes furniture in his own shop near the family home. He started this business in 1996 and has since made quality furnishings for the people of his town. Munkhtogtokh wants to one day own a stall in the large central market where he can expand his customer base, sell more furniture and further improve his family’s financial situation. In the 13 years of owning his business, Munkhtogtokh has not only gained experience and knowledge in making quality furniture products, but he has also gained business knowledge. He is requesting a 3,960,000 tugrug (~2800 USD) loan to buy more wood and furniture making supplies for his business.

loans.use: to buy more wood and furniture making supplies for his business.

loans.name: Sara Maria

texts.es: La señora Sara Maria L. S. tiene 55 años de edad. Ella es casada pero no tiene hijo. La señora L. S. se dedica a la compra-venta de productos varios tal como vestuario, zapatos, cosméticos y ahorita desea invertir este préstamo para la compra de artículos navideños ya que posee una mini librería ubicada en su casa de habitación y además de esto posee un cyber café, el cual esta ubicado en la parte central  y es administrado por un sobrino suyo. Cabe señalarse,que la señora ya posee 5 años de tenerla, los cuales en parte fueron establecidos gracias al apoyo recibido por la FL2000 a través de su financiamiento. El crédito será invertido en la compra de ropa variada, y adornos navideños a como había dicho anteriormente. Su sueño es llegar a tener un caber con cabinas telefónicas que permiten realizar llamadas nacionales e internacionales, además que desea invertir mas en el negocio para poder poner un negocio de vestuario.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Emerlina

texts.en:
Emerlina P. is from the village of Iligan City. She is 48 years old. Emerlina is married and has 11 school-aged children. To make a living, Emerlina owns & operates a business venture in the food sector by making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Emerlina has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Emerlina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emerlina is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Emerlina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Victor Albino

texts.es:
El señor Victor albino I., está muy agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual lo utilizo para poner la luz y el drenaje ya que era lo mas importante para habitar la vivienda.
Nueva mente está solicitando un préstamo para poder terminar los acabados de la casa y así este en mejor estado para sus hijos. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de su  ingreso que obtiene de su trabaja como guardia de seguridad privada.
texts.en:
Mr. Victor Albino I. is very grateful for the help with his last loan. He used it to install electricity and plumbing to make his home more liveable. He is again asking for a loan so that he can complete the house and have it in better shape for his children. He plans to pay the loan with a part of the money that he gets from his work as a private security guard.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish up the inside and outside of his home

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is unmarried and resides within Nairobi. Moses was introduced to KADET through existing clients and he has no credit history. He has been in the business of selling electrical appliances for eight years and he intends to use the loan to increase his stock of sockets, aerials and electric extension cords. He also sells greeting cards as a side business.

His business is located along a road and his clients are passers by. With the extra profits he plans to reinvest in the business and purchase more stock to open another outlet for selling electrical appliances.

Moses's future dream is to buy a plot of land and build rental houses. He describes himself as hardworking.

About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To add stock (sockets, aerials, electric extension cords, etc.)

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah has owned his butcher shop since 2007 and he's known in his town and by the neighboring villages. 

He has been involved in this business for the past 14 years. 

Today Abdallah is requesting to borrow $1,200 to purchase some cattle in order to increase his business production.

loans.use: To purchase some cattle.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita L.'s main source of income comes from selling doormats, aprons and sofa beddings. She is 46 years old, married and has four grown-up children. She is from the village of Marabulig 1, Cauayan City, Isabela. Anita has been in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2006, Anita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Anita is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase products to sell. This will be her 8th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement her family's income.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Risper Adhiambo

texts.en:
Risper Adhiambo O. is a businesswoman who owns and operates a cereals business. Her specialty is in selling groundnuts (peanuts). This is because, she says, local production of peanut butter has increased and the demand for the raw material is high.

Risper Adhiambo is 50 years old, is married and is the guardian of eight children. She would like a loan of Kshs 40,000 which will be used to increase her stock of groundnuts.

loans.use: To increase her stock of groundnuts

loans.name: Mi

texts.en: Mrs. Mi C. is 49 years old and she lives in the village of Kandal Koh Touch in Kandal Province. She and her husband, Mr. Sython Chheng, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice and vegetables.  They now face a problem because they do not have enough money to support their farm adequately. So, Mrs. Mi C. is applying for a loan to buy garlic seed, onion seed and fertilizer. Mrs. Mi C. is a mother of six children, three of whom are employed at a garment factory, and three of whom are students at a local school.

loans.use: To buy seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mais

texts.en:
Mais I. is a businessman from Agsu city where he lives with his wife and two children. He sells flour, cookies, soft drinks and some seasonal vegetables in the market.

Mais does a good business because he keeps his merchandise well stocked and makes sure it is good quality. Presently, he is making about $300 each month. Mais is very honest and polite with both his suppliers and his customers. It has helped him to gain a reputation as a trustworthy and friendly vendor and to build a solid client base.

Mais is applying for a loan of 1,600 AZN to restock his merchandise and hopefully generate additional profit. He is sincerely appreciative of your support!

loans.use: To restock his merchandise

loans.name: Loida Liza

texts.en:
Loida Liza V. is from the village of Balulang, Cagayan de oro City. She is 37 years old. Loida Liza is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Loida Liza has been making and selling food in the local community for over two years. Her main source of income is specialty food products and processed food like longganiza, chorizo and more. Loida Liza earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Loida Liza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services that could help her improve her living situation and ability to pursue business activities. Loida Liza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Loida Liza is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to again invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Hidalio

texts.es:
En el barrio Sócrates Sandino Municipio de Somotillo 
El  señor E. Z. realiza la venta de sus productos en el municipio de Somotillo el distribuye sus productos alos clientes del casco urbano y delas comarcas del municipio.
 El quiere el crédito para comprar la compra de 10 bolsas de cemento y de 100 bloques para la construcción de una pared   en  su casa de habitación y así mejorar su condición de vida y de su familia.
texts.en:
E. Z. lives in the surburb of Sócrates Sandino in the town of Somotillo. He sells his product in Somotillo, distributing product to urban areas and the regions in the municipality. E. wants a loan to purchase 10 bags of cement and 100 blocks to construct a wall in his house, and in this way improve the living conditions of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cement to build a wall

loans.name: Albino

texts.es:
Albino tiene 43 años de edad, es casado y tiene cinco hijos en edad escolar. Vive en la selva cuzqueña, en la localidad de “Quimbiri”, donde tiene su casa propia construida a base de madera y techo de calamina.

Para Albino el cultivo alternativo es la clave del éxito, cree que es mejor esforzarse para un mayor logro a mediano y a largo plazo, que el dinero fácil, y sin dañar el medio ambiente. Este pensamiento lo caracteriza como una persona emprendedora, que no se detiene ante los obstáculos que se le presentan. Desde hace 30 años se dedica al cultivo de café, achote y la hoja de coca, esta experiencia le da la oportunidad de obtener buenos resultados, obteniendo productos que vende en los centro de acopio de su localidad. En el futuro piensa aumentar su producción, comprando terrenos para sembrar sus tres productos al mismo tiempo. 

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete a pagar sus cuotas con puntualidad, ya que para él es muy importante contar con la oportunidad de crédito. Con el dinero solicitado piensa invertir en el mantenimiento de sus tierras, con la finalidad de producir a gran escala en un corto plazo.
texts.en:
Albino is 43 years old, married, and has five children who are of school age. He lives in the Cuscan jungle in the town of Quimbiri, where he has built his own house made of wood with a tin roof.

For Albino, crop rotation has been the key to his success. He believes it is better in the medium and long term because it results in easy money without damaging the environment. This belief shows that he is an enterprising person who is not stopped by obstacles that get in the way. Albino has been growing coffee, annatto, and coca leaf for thirty years. This experience has given him the opportunity to achieve good results and obtain products to sell to the local collection centers. In the future, he plans to increase his production by acquiring more land so that he can grow three products simultaneously.

This is Albino’s first loan with MFP. He promises to make his payments on time because this credit opportunity is very important to him. The money he requested will be invested in the maintenance of his land so that he can produce on a large scale in a short amount of time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for maintenance of his farmland

loans.name: Moustafa

texts.en: Moustafa lives in the Beirut, the capital of Lebanon. He is a 25-year-old single man. He is involved in retail sales. Moustafa has a mobile shop, where he sells phone accessories like covers, chargers, used mobile phones, phone recharge cards and more. He has been in this business since 2006. He is requesting the loan in order to purchase phones and their accessories. He wants to expand his business. This is his third loan and he has always paid on time. His previous loans allowed him to purchase merchandise and improve his sales, as well as his income.

loans.use: To purchase phones and accessories

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca A. is from the village of Tru-Cut Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old. Rebecca is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Rebecca owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily-use products such as sardines, salt, sugar, noodles, coffee, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Rebecca has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rebecca joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rebecca has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Rebecca is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Rebecca from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sara Concepcion

texts.es:
la sra. Sara Concepcion C. O. tiene 32 años de edad, vive en la Aldea Lazaro de la ciudad de San Lorenzo departamento de Valle.
Sara se dedica  a la compra y venta de lacteos como ser: quesillo, queso y mantequilla., tiene poco tiempo de realizar este tipo de actividad, la cual es muy buena ya que los lacteos son un producto que se venden muy bien, por motivos de falta de capital no puede comprar lacteos al por mayor.
en esta zona de San Lorenzo se producen buenos lacteos, tienen muy buen sabor.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de lacteos al por mayor y asi tener mejores ventas y mayores ganancias, las cuales las necesita para cubrir con los gastos del hogar y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
Sara es una mujer con muchos deseos de superacion.
texts.en:
Sara is 32 years old and lives in the Lazaro hamlet in the city of San Lorenzo, in the Valle department. Sara buys and sells milk products, such as cheeses and butter. She’s been doing this for a short time, but milk products sell very well. The milk products produced in this area are of very good quality and have a good flavor. She is unable to buy larger quantities because she lacks sufficient working capital. She will use the money from this loan to buy milk products in bulk and be able to increase her income, which she needs in order to cover her household expenses and provide a better quality of life for her family. Sara has a great desire to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Milk products

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: Patricia de 30 años es una madre de familia muy trabajadora y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Arnaldo de 39 años y sus 6 hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Trabajando arduamente Patricia ha logrado sacar adelante sus sembríos, todas las mañanas se levanta muy temprano para regar y brindarle el cuidado respectivo a su café y achiote los cuales posteriormente venderá en la ciudad de Pichanaki, ya que es ahí donde obtiene los mejores precios por sus productos. Disfruta mucho de la libertad que tiene al trabajar en sus campos, es así que ya lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar la tierra. Con el tiempo, espera poder adecuar sus tierras para plantar mucho más café. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, sabe que este crédito le ayudará bastante en el progreso y desarrollo de su negocio, es por eso que esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, en su grupo comunal es una socia muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy querida. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono y fertilizantes, para mejorar la calidad de sus tierras.
texts.en:
Patricia, who is 30 years old, is a hardworking and happy mother. She lives in her own home with her 39-year old husband, Arnaldo, and their 6 children, to whom she hopes to give a better quality of life. By working arduously, Patricia has managed to improve her plantings. She gets up very early every morning to water and care for her coffee and annatto, which she will later sell in the city of Pichanaki, where she gets the best prices for her products. She very much enjoys the freedom of working in the fields, which she has been doing for 20 years. She feels that the most difficult part is having to work the land. With time, she hopes to adapt her land to plant a lot more coffee. This is her third loan with MFP. She knows that this loan will help her quite a bit in the progress and development of her business, and for that reason she is determined to make all her payments punctually. She is a very responsible member of her communal group, which is why she is dear to them. With the 800 PEN she is requesting, she will purchase more manure and fertilizer to improve the quality of her land.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase manure and fertilizer to imrove the quality of the land.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en: Dina D. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 41 years old, married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Dina owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Dina has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2008, Dina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 16,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Dina is requesting a new loan of 19,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Dina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: God’S Time Is The Best Group

texts.en:
Augustine M., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called God’s Time Is The Best.

He is 42 years old, married and has three children who range from 10 to 15 years old. He holds an Associate of Arts degree.
  
For 10 years, he has been operating a tea shop, selling bread and tea, in V.I Community, Bong County, central Liberia. 

He plans to use his 9,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 35,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more sugar, packs of tea, milk, bread, eggs etc.

He describes himself as earnest.

His goal is to improve his business, build a store and continue to educate his children so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, packs of tea, milk, bread, eggs etc.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es: Sra. Lorena tiene su domicilio en la localidad de el torno distante a 39 km de la ciudad de Santa Cruz,  en el Barrio Villa Norte, tiene un hijo de un año, su esposo es funcionario publico en la Honorable  Alcaldía Municipal, su negocio es la venta de cosméticos de forma ambulante, vive en casa en anticrético, esta juntando dinero para construir su propia vivienda;  el destino del crédito es para construir una pequeña tienda para la venta de sus productos y necesita comprar pintura, material y también muebles para exponer sus productos, es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas ya que trabaja con la institución hace mucho tiempo.
texts.en:
Lorena lives in the Villa Norte neighborhood of El Torno, which is 39 kilometers from the city of Santa Cruz. She has a one year old child. Her husband is a public official in the municipal mayor’s office. Her business is selling cosmetics in an itinerant manner. She lives in “anticrético” (a special type of rental agreement in Bolivia). She is getting together money to build her own house. The loan is to build a small store to sell her products. She also needs to buy paint, material, and furniture to display her products. She is a hard-working person. She is responsible with her payments, and she has worked with the institution for a long time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a sales stand

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia M. is from the city of Sta. Cruz Ozamiz City. She is 48 years old. Letecia is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Letecia owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Letecia has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Letecia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Letecia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. Letecia is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Letecia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Chanthou's Group

texts.en:
Chantou C., 55, is the village bank president selected by the fourteen members of this group loan, located in Lvea Sa Leu village in Kandal province. Each member of this village will use their portion of the loan to support their different businesses.    

Chantou is a farmer who owns a 1.50-hectare piece of land to cultivate rice for a living.  She will use the loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and to hire a worker to plow her farm to cultivate rice.  Chantou is also the teacher in the local school and her husband is a village chief.  

With their occupations, they are able to earn a small income to support their family. This couple has five children, two are construction worker, one is a government worker and the other is a student.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer, pesticide and pay a laborer to plow her farm to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza B., from the village of Abu, Mambajao, Camiguin Province, is 38 years old, married, and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Liza owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately 3500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Liza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting her first loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata”; El banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Yuncaypata, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria; ella tiene 19 años de edad y es conviviente  y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  negocio de venta de productos secos y crianza de animales menores como gallinas, cuyes y cerdos, la socia vende productos como quinua, moraya y trigo en la diferentes ferias que se realizan en la ciudad de Cusco, los animales también los vende en estas ferias y en los mercados, la socia quiere tener un lugar más amplio para la crianza de los animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar  animales y  alimentos para los animales.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Maria belongs to the communal bank “Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata," which is located in the community of Yuncaypata, which is part of the Cusco province and department. Maria is 19 years old, lives with a partner, and has a 1 year-old son. She alternates her daily activities between 2 businesses: a business selling dry goods, and a business raising small animals such as hens, guinea pigs and pigs. For her first business she sells quinoa, dried potatoes, and wheat in various markets that are held around the city of Cusco. She also sells her animals at these markets. Maria wants to have a bigger place to raise animals. She requests a loan to buy animals and feed for the animals. Maria thanks everyone who makes it possible for her to pursue her dreams through these loans, and she pledges to make her payments according to the established timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy animals and feed for the animals

loans.name: Tsogtbayar

texts.en: Tsogtbayar D. is 26 years old and lives with his wife and two year-old son in Arhangai province in central Mongolia.  He lives with his family in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent home. His wife works as a hairdresser in the hair salon. Tsogtbayar manages a raw material trading business in his town. He started his business in 2006 with a capital of 350,000 MNT.  After years of experience in his trade, he has established a stable operation and a good position in the business community.  Today, his working capital exceeds 1,600,000 MNT.  For the future he hopes to continue to grow his business and says, "I want to supply good quality materials in the local market".  He is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more raw materials in order to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase more raw materials

loans.name: Rubi Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal Rubi inicia su ciclo 44 con 20 socias, las cuales tienen diversos negocios y pertenecen a la ciudad D. Huamanga.
Margoth es Presidenta del Bancomunal, tiene 23 años, es soltera y se dedica a la atención D. una cebichería, trabaja como mesera y cocinera en los horario D. 7am a 4pm,  pero tiene una dificultad es que no le pagan puntualmentesu salario mensual, el préstamo que solicita es para la compra D. abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, aceite, harina, fideos, huevo, detergentes, jabón, galletas y demás dulces, etc, los cuales lo venD. en las ferias.
El sueño D. Margoth es poder tener su propia cebichería. Se siente muy feliz D. ser la presidenta y se ha propuesto que su Bancomunal sea modelo y que las socias sean puntuales en cuanto a la asistencia y pago.
texts.en:
The Rubi communal bank began their 44th loan with 20 members who have different businesses and belong to the city of Huamanga.
 Margoth is the president of the communal bank, she is 23 years old, single and works in a cebichería (place that sells ‘ceviche,’ marinated fish cocktails) she works as a waitress and cook. She works from 7 a.m. to 4 p.m. but she has problems since they don’t pay her wages on time. The loan is to buy groceries like rice, sugar, oil, flour, spaghetti, eggs, detergents, soap, cookies and candies, etc. all of which is sold in fairs.
 Margoth’s dream is to have her own cebichería. She is very happy to be president and is committed to making her communal bank a model one, and that her fellow members be punctual in their attendance and payments.

loans.use: To buy groceries, rice, sugar, spaghetti, etc.

loans.name: Wilson Kipnyagan

texts.en:
Wilson K. is 38 years old and married to Sarah Ronoh. They have been blessed with seven children aged between 3 and 17 years. Sarah supports him with an income of 1,500 KES per month. Wilson runs a butcher shop that he started a year ago. This business gives him an income of 2,000 KES a month. 

For his first loan, Wilson is borrowing 10,000 KES. He intends to use all the money to buy animals for slaughter. He anticipates using his profits to increase the number of animals for slaughter and open a retail shop. Wilson hopes to expand his business and give his children the best education.

loans.use: To purchase animals for slaughter

loans.name: Ulziit

texts.en:
Ulziit D. is 33 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in Uvs province, Mongolia. She works as a cook in a five-star restaurant to supplement her family's income. Ulziit and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her daughter, age 13, attends a local secondary school while her husband has been operating a meat trading business since 2003 to support the family. After years of success in the business, her husband was able to purchase a plot of land and fence for his family’s ger.

In 2008, in addition to his meat business, Ulziit’s husband decided to open a retail clothing business out of a rented stall at the local market. Using their business profits, they also purchased and own a small grocery shop next to their home. Her husband plans to continue operating his meat business during the winter when it is very profitable.

Since operating their businesses, their quality of life has been improving year by year. Ulziit is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan for their meat trading business. She hopes to continue being successful and to grow her businesses.

loans.use: For capital for their meat business

loans.name: Dutanfaye Group

texts.fr: Damien R. est agriculteur du riz, et il est un membre du groupe Dufatanye. Il est marie, et il a 3 enfants entre 3 ans et 26 ans. Deux de ses enfants vont a l'ecole. Son niveau d'education est l'annee 5eme primaire, et il va utiliser son pret pour acheter des fertilisantes urees et NPK, et aussi pour le main d'oeuvre. Sa strategie pour la croissance de l'affaire est d'accroitre l'activite de l'agriculture du riz. Il voudrait accroitre les activites actuelles, et acheter une maison.
texts.en:
Damien R. is a rice farmer, and member of the Dufatanye group. He is married with three children, whose ages range from 3 to 26 years. Two of his children attend school, and he attended school himself until the 5th grade.

He will use his loan to buy urea fertilizers and NPK (Nitrogen Phosphorus Potassium), and also to hire field hands. His strategy for growing his business is to increase the rice-growing activity. He wants to raise his current activity level and buy a house.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer, hire field hands.

loans.name: Peter Mburu

texts.en:
Peter is 46 years old, married to Philis Wairimu a business lady. They have three children. He has been in the transport business for a period of 15 years with an income of Kshs. 45,000 per month. 

This is his first loan from KADET LTD and he wants to use it to top up his saving and buy another passenger vehicle, or Matatu. He hopes to expand his business and improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To top up his savings and buy another passenger vehicle(Matatu)

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en: Maribel belongs to the “Solidaridad Cachimayo” cooperative bank, which is located in the Cachimayo district of the province of Chinceros. She is 33 years old and has a common-law husband and two children. She is requesting the loan to send her sister to Lima to buy more inventory of shoes and underwear, which Maribel will sell wholesale to other vendors. She is very happy with the loan granted, and commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: Invest in wholesale clothing business

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia forma parte del banco comunal “Millaray”, perteneciente a la ciudad de Temuco.  Ella tiene una pensión para estudiantes,  hace 20 años, la cual atiende solo de marzo a diciembre. Después que quedó viuda, su pareja le ayuda en la mantención y administración de la pensión. El servicio que entrega Sonia a sus clientes incluye aseo y comida. 
Durante los meses de enero y febrero, no arrienda la pensión porque prefiere descansar y hacer las reparaciones que sean necesarias. Se apoya económicamente por una pequeña suma de dinero que recibe como pensión de viudez por su difunto marido y  cocina para vender humitas y pastel de choclo.
Con este préstamo Sonia comprará 5 puertas para cambiar las que tienen las habitaciones de su pensión y también contratará a un maestro para que repare una gotera del techo y pinte una parte de su terraza.
El sueño de Sonia es construir un 2º piso con más habitaciones para arrendar. 
Su motivación es ayudar económicamente a sus 3 hijas y nietos, con quienes, aunque no viven con ella, Sonia se siente comprometida.
A Sonia le han servido mucho los préstamos que recibe de Fondo Esperanza, ya  que cuenta con ese capital de forma segura. Las capacitaciones le han servido para organizar sus gastos. También se siente muy bien por la confianza que se le mostró al concederle los préstamos y además tiene una muy buena relación con sus compañeros de grupo.
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the "Millaray" community bank which is located in the city of Temuco.  She has been running a guest house for students for 20 years.  She works there from March to December.  Sonia is a widow.  Her partner helps her to maintain and run the guest house.  Sonia's services include cleaning and providing food.

During the months of January and February, Sonia doesn't rent out her guest house because she prefers to rest and make any necessary repairs.  She is supported financially by a small sum of money that she receives as her widow's pension and also from cooking and selling 'humitas' and 'pastel de choclo' (traditional dishes).

Sonia will use this loan to buy five doors to replace existing doors on the rooms in her guest house.  She will also hire a master builder to repair a leak in the roof and paint part of her outdoor area.  Sonia's dream is to build a second floor with more rooms to rent out.  Her motivation is to financially help her three daughters and grandchildren to whom she feels very committed, even though they no longer live with her.

Sonia's previous loans from Fondo Esperanza have been very useful.  It has been useful for her to be able to rely on this capital.  The training sessions have also helped her to organize her expenses.  She feels very good about the fact that Fondo Esperanza have placed their trust in her by giving her the loans.  She also has a very good relationship with her fellow group members.

Temuco is the capital of Araucanía region.  The city is located 670 kilometers to the south of Santiago (the capital of Chile).  On the outskirts of the city, there are a series of lakeside resorts (Pucón, Villarrica) and very colorful native flora and fauna can be found in nearby nature reserves.  We feel it is worth pointing out that this region is home to 50% of the Mapuches (indigenous people) in our country.

loans.use: To buy five doors and pay for repairs

loans.name: Ruslana

texts.en:
Ruslana is divorced. She raises two sons by herself. Her husband doesn’t want to be involved and doesn’t help Ruslana financially. 

Challenging circumstances forced her to find ways to feed her family. This is how Ruslana ended up as a market vendor and a small entrepreneur five years ago. Currently, she sells footwear in the local marketplace of her home town of Mukachevo. She has about 35,000 Grivnyas invested in her business. 

Ruslana is known for her integrity and consistency in dealings with clients. She works hard to keep her venture afloat. This time Ruslana is seeking a loan of 20,000 Grivnyas to continue growing her business and working capital.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal inventory

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena B. is 35 years old, married and blessed with 2 school-aged children. She lives in the village of New Dapitan, Rizal. Lorena owns and operates a grocery store, selling assorted products in the local community. Lorena has been engaged in her business for 10 years and earns a monthly net income of 3,500 PHP.

In 2010, Lorena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to invest in expanding the business. Lorena is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase new stock for the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Lorena from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock

location.town: Calamba-New Dapitan, Rizal, Zambo. Del Norte

loans.name: Dorjrenchin

texts.en:
Dorjrenchin, 28, is married and lives with his wife and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia.They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in another person's backyard. They currently have a below average standard of living. 

Dorjrenchin began delivering petrol in 2009. He was renting his sister's truck to deliver petrol, but purchased it from her last year. He buys large amounts of petrol at a wholesale price and sells it for a higher price. His business is new to the local market and his customers are happy to get this service as it makes their job easier. His business is becoming more stable.

Dorjrenchin is a hardworking, polite and caring person who says, " I work hard in order to take care of my children and wife and support their needs". He is requesting a loan of 3,700,000 MNT to purchase more petrol to keep in reserve and sell in the future.

loans.use: To purchase petrol to resell

loans.name: Marceline

texts.en:
Marceline is 41 years old and married, with four children between 2 and 15 years old. She owns a business selling clothes. Her business is open from 8am to 6pm every day, and she employs one person to help her. Marceline has two years experience in this business.  

Marceline has requested a Kiva loan, via Vision Finance Company, for the purpose of expanding her business by purchasing more clothes to sell.  Through this expansion, Marceline will be able to earn more profit, which will be used as savings for the future.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella S. is married and has five children, four of whom still attend school while one has graduated from school. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and clothing. 

For the past 21 years, she has operated a fish-selling business and she also sells maandazi (dumplings) from home to her neighbors and passersby. 

Stella faces a major challenge of seasonality and high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of establishing another business in the market. 

Stella decided to access loans to improve her living standards. With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase a Kenyan ceramic jiko (an efficient charcoal stove) and renovate her selling stall.

loans.use: to purchase a Kenyan ceramic jiko and renovate her selling stall

loans.name: Tasleem's Group

texts.en:
Tasleem lives in Faisalabad which is Pakistan’s third largest city and known for its textile industry. She resides in a 2-room brick house with her family in the area of Mian Pind. She moved here 15 years ago. She is 39 years old, married to M. J., and has six sons. Her three elder sons do different kind of work while younger ones are enrolled in a local school and are getting their education. 

Tasleem herself is an active and a responsible person by nature. She stays at home and carries out her responsibilities as a housewife very well. She makes the utmost effort to provide comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs. 

Her husband is a vegetable vendor. He put the vegetables on his cart and visits different streets of the city to sell them. Tasleem has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s vegetable selling business. Using the loan, he will buy fresh seasonal vegetables for sale. He will also repair his cart because it has rotted in some areas which don’t carry vegetables. 

Tasleem hopes that this investment will bring positive changes to her husband’s business and his monthly income will grow up.  She is a new loan user and this is her first loan application with Asasah. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Tasleem.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal vegetables and repair his cart.

loans.name: Protais

texts.fr: Protais T. est agriculteur dans le secteur du Rubavu.  Il a 31 ans, il est marié, et il a un enfant.  Il est ne a Rubavu, au Rwanda, et il a fini 6 ans d’école secondaire.  Ce crédit est son premier cycle avec ACB, et il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter des matériels pour son activité d’agriculture des roseaux.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de développer son business, augmenter la capacité tout en sollicitant beaucoup des prêts.  Il voudrait devenir un grand businessman dans le secteur de Rubavu, et construire une maison d’habitation pour sa famille.
texts.en: Protais T. is a farmer in the Rubavu area. He is 31 years old, married, with one child. He was born in Rubavu, in Rwanda, and finished six years of secondary school. This loan is his first experience with ACB. He is going to use the loan to purchase supplies for his agricultural business ( growing reeds). His strategy is to keep developing his business, increasing his volume and taking out many loans. He would like to become a big businessman in Rubavu and build a house for his family to live in.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies for growing reeds

loans.name: Dania

texts.es: Dania madre soltera, vive en un barrio, la seguridad y protección es primordial, sus planes preparar a su hijo para un futuro mejor. Tiene un trabajo honesto, humilde de mucho esfuerzo, trabaja como conserje desde hace un gran tiempo y vende productos de una casa comercial productos para damas.  Con la necesidad de mejorar la infraestructura de su casa para ofrecerle mayor comodidad a su familia. Anteriormente presto para ladrillar el piso de la vivienda, a esta altura del camino al mejoramiento está requiriendo construir su cuarto para obtener mayor privacidad y seguridad, con el préstamo comprara cemento, bloques, piedras cantera, hierro, arena, piedrín, lamina de zinc entre otros productos.
texts.en: Dania is a single mother; she lives in a community where safety and security are a top concern. Her plans are to prepare her son for a better future. She has an honest and humble occupation which requires a great deal of effort. She has been working as a janitor for a very long time and she also sells ladies' products from a specific commercial brand. She needs to improve the infrastructure of her home in order to provide her family with greater comfort. She previously borrowed to tile the floors in the house. At this stage of the home improvement project she needs to build a bedroom for greater privacy and security. With the loan she will purchase cement, construction blocks, rocks, steel, sand, gravel, sheets of zinc, and other materials.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a bedroom.

loans.name: Tamasha

texts.en:
Tamasha is a 51 year-old woman from Bilasuvar, Azerbaijan. She is married and lives with her husband and three children. All her children are adults, aged between 19 and 25, and help their parents. They are very diligent family.  The goal of Tamasha and her husband is to support a better life.  

Tamasha owns and operates a store which sells a variety of different home products. She started her business in 2004. This is the first loan Tamasha’s received from AqroInvest and Kiva. She used this loan of 700 AZN to buy more goods to sell in her store. Tamasha hopes this loan will improve income and her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more goods.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children.
 
Lucita has a retail shop that sells a variety of office and school supplies. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy additional office and school supplies.

Lucita has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Lucita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional office and school supplies.

loans.name: Danilse De Jesus

texts.es: Danilse vive en Soledad un municipio a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Barranquilla donde se dedica a la fabricación de ropa en su negocio llamado “Confecciones Danilse” ella  es casada y tiene dos hijos en las edades de 21 y 23 años con los que sueña ver prósperos y exitosos.  Confecciones Danilse inició su negocio en el año 1991 al contraer matrimonio, para poder atender sus obligaciones familiares mientras generaba ingresos. Así fue como empezó con una máquina sencilla, una fileteadora  y una recubridora luego adicionó dos máquinas planas y con los financiamientos recibidos a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo que hoy son 24,  ha logrado también agregar una bordadora, así como aumentar su capital de trabajo, pagar su vivienda totalmente y con ello incrementar su bienestar familiar . El credikiva es su financiamiento # 19, con el planea comprar telas para fabricar pantalones masculinos y camisas encargadas por sus nuevos clientes pues se propone aumentarlos, para generar una mayor rentabilidad que le permita lograr apoyar a sus hijos en su profesionalización y  construir el segundo piso de su vivienda, lo cual es su mayor desafío.
texts.en:
Danilse lives in Soledad, a town which is located 15 minutes from the city of Barranquilla.  There she has a dressmaking business called 'Confecciones Danilse'.  Danilse is married and has two children, aged 21 and 23, who she dreams of seeing prosper and succeed.

Danilse started her business in 1991, when she got married, so that she could attend to her family obligations whilst making income.  She started out with a simple sewing machine, an overlock machine and a 'recubridora' (a special machine used for hemming).  She then added two flat machines and, through the loans that she has received from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, she has also managed to add an embroidery machine.  In addition, she has increased her working capital, completely paid off her house and thereby improved her family's well-being.

This Kiva loan is Danilse's 19th loan.  She plans to use it to buy material for making men's pants and shirts ordered by her new customers.  She is planning to increase her number of customers in order to make better profits which will allow her to support her children in becoming professionals and also enable her to build a second level on her home.  This is her greatest challenge.

loans.use: to buy material for making men's pants and shirts to order

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is 38 years old, married and has four children.  Five years ago, she started practicing dairy farming to earn a living.  She also relies on her husband for financial support.  She works hard at her business so as to educate her four children, who all go to school.
	
Naomi dreams of owning a ranch in the future.  She has requested 50,000 Kenyan shillings to build a zero-grazing unit and buy a chuff cutter.

loans.use: To build a zero-grazing unit and buy a chuff cutter.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence lives in Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. Florence lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but no piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and food for the family.
Florence has a food stall business. She has been in this business for five years, and she works six days a week. Florence sells her products at the market, by means of wholesale/retail. Florence has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy to buy more baskets of tomatoes and onions. Florence earns additional income through hiring out her bicycle. The main business challenges for Florence include perishability and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to buy directly from farmers and also to start growing tomatoes herself.

loans.use: to buy more baskets of tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MARIA ELENA MOYANO”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito D. Huanchac en la Provincia D. Cusco y Departamento D. Cusco.

La socia Josefina, La socia tiene 62 años D. edad, la socia es casada y  tiene 1 hijo D. 36 años D. edad, la socia se dedica  a la atención D. su tienda y depósito D. cervezas,  la socia también tiene un restaurante, la socia requiere el crédito para invertir en la compra D. insumos para el negocio al por mayor como aceite, arroz, fideos, la socia también comprara cubiertos y paltos para su negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. ingredientes y D. cubiertos y vasija para el negocio.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir D. manera disciplinada con los pagos D. las cuotas.
texts.en:
Josefina, 62, belongs to the “María Elena Moyano” communal bank that’s located in Huanchac District in Cusco Province and Department.

She is married and has a 36-year-old son.  She tends to her grocery store and beer warehouse.  She also has a restaurant.  She needs the loan to buy ingredients, like rice, oil and noodles, for the business at wholesale.  She also needs to buy cutlery and dinnerware for the business.  She is asking for the loan to buy ingredients, cutlery and dinnerware for the business.

She is grateful for the support she’ll be given and pledges to make her installment payments in a disciplined way.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, cutlery and dinnerware.

loans.name: Elisa Aparri Group

texts.en:
Elisa, 58 years old, is married and has 3 children. She lives in Punta Miray, Baliangao. Elisa has operated a business selling snacks for 20 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase raw ingredients for her snacks.

Elisa has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. She is the leader of a 2-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients for her snacks

loans.name: Novy

texts.en:
Novy is a 35-year-old married man from the town of Banga, South Cotabato. He is a father of two children, who are 7 and 3 years old.

Novy is a farmer. He grows rice crops to sell. He also raises pigs in his backyard. He sells his pigs at the market. He plans to use his loan to purchase 2 sacks of feeds, 3 sacks of fertilizers and 1 quart of herbicides. Novy hopes to grow his business.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sacks of feeds, 3 sacks of fertilizers and 1 quart of herbicides

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en: Felisa is a businesswoman who has a small grocery store where she sells basic daily needs such as canned goods, shampoo, spices, body creams and other products. She has benefited from prior loans, which she invested in her business. The current loan that she is requesting is to purchase basic grains such as rice, sugar, canned goods, snack foods, and candies to sell. In addition, she will buy cosmetics such as lotions, creams and shampoo. Her husband and children help her tend to the business after they arrive home from school.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, canned good, snack foods, and candies for her store

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE WIMPILLAY CHOCO”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Rosa; la socia tiene 35 años de edad. La socia es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos  de 7 y 3 años de edad; la socia se dedica a la administración de sus tienda de abarrotes, la socia tiene en su propia casa una tienda de abarrotes en la cual vende todo lo referente a productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, fideos, atún, galletas, gaseosas entre otras cosas más por unidad y kilos. La socia desea invertir el crédito en la compra de productos de abarrotes como los mencionados. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de leche, arroz, azúcar, fideos y otros productos.
La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the 'Señor de Wimpillay Choco' community bank which is located in Huanchac district, in Cusco province and department.

Rosa is 35 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children aged 7 and 3.  She runs a grocery store which is located in her own home.  She sells all kinds of essential household products such as rice, sugar, milk, oil, noodles, tuna, cookies, soda and other products which are sold by the unit or by the kilo.  Rosa would like to invest her loan in buying groceries such as those we have mentioned.  She is requesting her loan to invest in buying milk, rice, sugar, noodles, etc.

Rosa is grateful for the support that she is being given and pledges to make her loan repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to invest in buying milk, rice, sugar, noodles and other products

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina is 52 years old and widowed. She has six children for whom she is responsible. Her family's main business is agriculture, particularly pigs and rice farming. Three of her children are in charge of looking after and maintaining their rice fields. 

Florentina has raised hogs for almost 17 years. In addition, she also buys and sells bananas. According to her, she buys her product at Sta. Maria Alfonso Lista, Ifugao. She desires to increase her income in order to continuing meeting the needs of her family. Due to increased household expenses, she couldn't buy additional bananas and feed for her piglets. For this reason, she is requesting additional capital of 7,000 PHP to purchase bananas and feed supplies for raising piglets.

In the future, Florentina hopes to successfully raise all of her piglets and sell them at a very good price so that she can improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy bananas and feed for piglets

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 43 years old. She is married with four children. 

Julieta has a shop where she sells vegetables and spices like onions and garlic. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy additional vegetables and spices as additional stocks for the store. Julieta has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Julieta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables and spices to sell

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is 25 years old and single; he supports his parents. He  is a farmer and he has been farming  for the last four years. His farm is in a productive area, which has proved to be good for wheat farming.

Benard is requesting his first loan, which he will use to prepare his wheat farming.  His farm normally does well due to good climatic conditions n his area. He learned about KADET  LTD through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. 

Benard hopes to use the profit from this loan to educate his children and to acquire more land for farming so that he can increase his wheat production. His hope is to become a large scale farmer and buy a bigger piece of land. He is an energetic man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to prepare his wheat farming.

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru: Алишер ответственный и целеустремленный молодой человек. Более 10 лет он занимается купле- продажей запчастей. За товарами он ездит сам в Ташкент и привозит хорошие высококачественные товары. Торговая точка находится в центре вещевого рынка. Кроме того он продает хозяйственные товары. Более 10лет, полученную прибыль расходует на лечение супруги. Его супруга находится в больнице города Ташкента и он хочет вылечить её и привезти домой. Он мечтает получить большую прибыль, с этой цель он запрашивает займ для расширения ассортимента товаров. Обещает погасить займ в срок. Заранее благодарит КИВА и ИМОН за поддержку и помощь.
texts.en: Alisher is a responsible and goal-oriented young man. For more than ten years, he has sold car parts. He personally travels to Tashkent to stock up on high quality products. His retail space is located in the center of the market. He also sells household goods. For more than ten years, he has spent his income on medical care for his wife, who is in a hospital in Tashkent. Alisher wants to provide her with treatment and care, and to bring her home once she is healthy again. He hopes to increase his income, and with that goal, he is requesting a loan, to widen his selection of products. He promises to repay the loan on time. He is thankful to Kiva and IMON for their support and assistance.

loans.use: to purchase goods to increase the selection available for retail

loans.name: Sopheak

texts.en:
Sopheak is a 30-year old mother of two children, who are still in school. She also has one sister living with her. To make a living, she has been farming for 11 years in a rural area of Ponhea Krek district. To better feed her family, she also plants cassava to generate additional income. 

This is Sopheak's first loan with VisionFund. She is now requesting for a loan. She will use this loan to build a small tailor shop for her sister. With this loan, she hopes to better support her sister to have a good business with regular income, which will generate more income for the family and also build on some savings for the future to keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy a small tailor shop for her sister.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.
 
Gemma has a shop that sells detergent, canned goods, and spices. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy spices, detergent, and canned goods to sell.

Gemma has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy spices, detergent, and canned goods to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children. Sarah has a food shop, or sari-sari store, that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 25,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Sarah has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Sarah hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 46 years old and she is married to Joseph. They are blessed with three children. She has been running a driving school for the past four years with a monthly income of KES 32,000, which she uses to support her family.

Agnes is applying for her first loan with KADET after having been introduced to the lending agency by an existing KADET customer. She will use the loan to service the driving school lorries. With the anticipated profit from her business, she will educate her children. Her hope is to expand her business and open other branches.

loans.use: to service the lorries for her driving school.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Enter

texts.es:
Enter es una mujer de 27 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con sus 2 pequeños hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; a Enter le hubiera gustado mucho poder ser una gran Maestra de Escuela, en sus ratos libres le gusta trabajar y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Cau Cau para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, Enter puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de productos de cocina, tales como especerías, gaseosas y adicionalmente hielo, todos los días desde tempranas horas inicia su labor, ella puede trabajar un aproximado de 12 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por su buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Enter se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería para su negocio, tales como: aceite, golosinas, bolsas y otros artículos; de esta manera Enter tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido, con ello espera aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda tener su minimarket y ser una distribuidora de hielo, así ella desea poder cumplir su gran sueño de ver a sus hijos convertidos en buenos profesionales y en hombres de bien.

loans.use: Para la compra de mercadería para su negocio.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Hello world, meet an amazing woman by the name of Mercy. She is a smallholder farmer based in Kilibwoni village in the Nandihills area of Kenya. She is married to Naftali, whom she has been together with for almost a decade. She has two children who commute to school from home every school day. 

Mercy has been practicing livestock farming for seven years to help her husband cover family expenses. She has managed to raise cows and poultry on the farm. She also makes extra money doing a side hustle business. 

Mercy is seeking a loan to restock her cereals business. She plans to use your money to purchase and transport cereals in bulk to far markets, where she will sell at prices high enough to cover all the expenses incurred plus profit. 

Mercy is confident that she will be able to repay the loan in time because she is hardworking and financially disciplined. Returns from the investment will change her life, as she will use the additional income to raise her family's living standards and pay for her children's education. 

To do this she is counting on the lenders on the Kiva website to help him during this festive season.

loans.use: To pay for cereals

loans.name: Trivenia

texts.en: Trivenia is a businesswoman from Calamba. She is 68 years old, widow and has the expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. Trivenia is a full fledged member of PMPC and has took several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. Now, she applied a loan to restock store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Trivenia continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock store with basic commodities and other consumable items

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa is mother of three children, two of which are married and the youngest one is currently studying a professional career. Her husband works as a taxi driver, for which his income is very variable. For this reason two years ago she started to sell shoes by catalogue. Her primary goal is to see her son finish his university studies, it is for him that she has fought so hard to continue this project. Without this business she would have no resources to cover the cost of their son’s education.

To realize her dream, Felipa requires a loan of $475 that will be put towards the purchase of merchandise to increase her sales, but more importantly to be able to pay off some outstanding accounts, for if she does not pay them she will not be able to go on. You have the power to help her and contribute to the training of their children. Make your decision – they thank you for it.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Felipa es madre de 3 hijos, dos de ellos están casados y el más pequeño se encuentra estudiando una carrera profesional. Su esposo trabaja en un taxi, por lo que sus ingresos son muy variables y eventuales, por esta razón hace 2 años ella comenzó a vender zapatos por catálogo. Su principal objetivo es que su hijo culmine sus estudios universitarios, es por ello que ha luchado muchísimo para continuar con este proyecto, pues sin esta actividad no tendrían los recursos para costear la educación de su hijo.

Para poder cristalizar su sueño, Felipa requiere de un préstamo de $475 dólares, mismo que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para poder incrementar sus ventas, pero más importante aún para poder pagar unas facturas que tiene pendientes, pues si no las cubre ya no podrá continuar. Tú tienes el poder de ayudarla y contribuir a la formación de sus hijos, decídete, ellos te lo agradecen

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Hoang

texts.en:
Hoang is 42 and her husband is 52. They have three children between 16 and 23, and a grandchild. The eldest daughter was divorced when she was pregnant. Both Hoang's husband and son have heart problems. The youngest child is a student at secondary school.

Hoang's family has 2,000 square meters of land where they grow rice. However, the main source of income comes from selling handicraft products made from dry water hyacinths. Their income is about $9 per person/month. Hoang said, "If I have enough capital, I can choose and buy better dry water hyacinths, and purchase the dry water hyacinths before the rainy season". Hoang needs a loan of $75 in order to buy the materials for handicrafts. Hoang promises to repay monthly.

loans.use: To purchase dry water hyacinths before rainy season. She wants to purchase better quality water hyacinths for handicraft products.

loans.name: Uch

texts.en: Mrs. Uch C. is 38 years old and lives with her husband and six children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  C. is a farmer and can make about $2 per day in her work.  Her husband, meanwhile, is a construction worker and makes about $2.50 per day.  Of their six children, two of them work at a nearby garment factory, while the others are still students.  They hope to use this loan in order to purchase a motorcycle to reduce their transportation costs.  In the future, they hope that they will be able to continue to support their children's education so that they can finish high school.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her transportation

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
I have run this small convenience store for three years. Now I need to purchase more products in order to sell common goods like bananas, beans, rice, tortillas, churros and bread. This business helps me purchase medicines and afford electricity, water and the like. It is my only source of income. I would like it if you helped me be able to purchase these products, give my customers a better service and increase my sales.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Yo tengo este pequña pulperia hace 3 años, ahora nesecito comprar mas productos para poder vender mas como: platanos, frijoles, arroz, tortilla en bolsas, churros, confites y pan. Con ete negocio me puedo comprar yo mis medicinas ya tambien pagar gastos como electricidad, agua y otros. Este es el unico sustento que tengo. me gustaria que me ayudaran para poder comprar estos productos y asi dar un mejor servicio a mis clientes y tener mas ventas.

loans.use: Purchase churros, rice, beans, sugar, bread, etc.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
For a living, I add sequins on embroidered shirts that are ordered for a local boutique. My husband is a rickshaw (local three-wheeled taxi) driver. Together, we have five children, of whom are studying.

Moreover, as my children are growing, so are their needs. The rickshaw is our major source of income, as I do not get sequins orders regularly. For sequined clothing, the number of orders really depend on the customer demand and season.

Currently, our rickshaw needs maintenance which will cost us up to $175 USD. However, we do not have the money to get it repaired. Therefore, we are asking for a loan of $175 USD which we will pay back over 12 months.

loans.use: To repair rickshaw

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase additional merchandise.

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is divorced with a grown son. Her family lives in Nikopol. Nataliya sells terry robes and men’s and women’s undergarments in the central market of Nikopol. She has a wide variety of merchandise combined with reasonable prices. Nataliya has been in this trade for 9 years, and presently, her turnover capital is about $1000.

Nataliya is trying to do everything she can to provide for her family and give her son a decent education. That is why she wants to continue expanding her business and growing her trade by increasing the number of her vending locations. Nataliya is requesting a loan of $1000 to sustain her business and help ensure it continues to provide enough income to live on.

loans.use: To open a new vending spot

loans.name: Renee

texts.es:
Renee is 22 years old and is a responsible father who is ready to work hard in order to make his family comfortable and to take care of them. He works as a chauffeur in a transportation company that covers the area in which he lives. Taking advantage of being able to move between different neighborhoods and departments, he also sells and distributes different herbal medicines. While he is working, his beloved wife Cipriana helps him in his business and also takes care of his 3 year old son, Adrian. This young husband, full of love, would like to build a little house for his family, giving them comfort, security and a better life. At the moment they live in his parents home, but knowing he would like to have a home of his own, pushes him to work even harder. He would like to take advantage of this opportunity to apply for a loan to invest in it's entirety in his business. Renee needs your collaboration in this project to make it a reality.

Translated from Spanish to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.
