The 'Grupo de Mujeres Carbon Chinipamba' community bank is located in Carbón Chinipamba neighborhood, in Cuatro Esquinas sector, in Guaranda canton, twenty minutes from Cooperativa's offices.  Most of the members of the bank work in farming, livestock raising and sales.  They produce rice, barley, beans, quinoa, potatoes and animals such as dairy cows and farmyard animals.

Gladys farms crops.  She owns just over 4 'cuadras' of farmland (1 cuadra = approx. 6,400m2).  She owns her own home and grows corn, potatoes and beans.  She has four head of cattle, pigs and sheep.  She makes her purchases in Guaranda market and makes her sales in the wholesale market in the same city.

Gladys is requesting this loan to buy supplies and feed for her animals.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges such as pests, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to buy a vehicle and to buy land in Guanujo.

Gladys enjoys spending time with her children and looking after her home.

loans.use: to buy supplies and feed for her animals

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
Doña  María Guadalupe, vive en el Estado de Chiapas México, a su responsabilidad tiene cinco hijos y son: asunción de dieciocho años, Santa Luciana de once años, Luis de once años, Narciso de nueve años y Elizabeth de siete años de edad.
    Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de pollos  de granja par criarlo y luego venderlo en la misma localidad, en donde lleva cinco años y comenta que el va bien ya que con ello está logrando sacar adelante a sus hijos que le quedaron pequeños ya que desafortunadamente su esposo falleció  y sé que sola con sus hijo.
    Su inspiración comenzó por si sola  ya que para tener ingresos en su hogar tenía que tener una actividad que le deje ganancias así lograr sacar adelante a sus hijos que son mayor razón de trabajar.
    Su más grande deseo es con que esta actividad pueda seguir trabajando para que así también logre tener a horror y darles una mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
María Guadalupe lives in the State of Chiapas, Mexico.  She has five children in her care: 18 year-old Asunción, 11 year-old Santa Luciana, 11 year-old Luis, 9 year-old Narciso and 7 year-old Elizabeth.  

María's business is buying chickens which she raises and then sells in her town.  She has been in this business for five years and says that it is doing well as it is enabling her to get her children ahead in life.  She and her children were left alone after her husband died.

María made the decision to start her own business since she needed to make income for her household.  She needed a business which would make her profits and enable her to get her children, who are her biggest reason for working, ahead in life.

María's biggest wish is to continue working in this business so that she can save some money and provide her children with a better education.

loans.use: to buy chickens which she will sell in her town

loans.name: Elmer

texts.en:
Elmer  is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. 

Elmer  has a shop that sells canned goods, beverages and biscuits. He has had this business for 20 years. He requested a loan for PHP 16,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and breads.

Elmer  has been a member of HSPFI since 2007. In the future, Elmer hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and breads

loans.name: Catalina Hortencia

texts.es:
Catalina D. 42 años, vive en una zona peri-urbana en el Fortín D. Guayaquil. Es separada y tiene dos hijos D. 23 años que esta en L. universidad y D. 13 años que esta en colegio. Se dedica a L. venta D. comida.

Empezó hace 10 años atrás,  con L. venta D. un carro que hizo decidió abrir un comedor , y elL. antes era cocinera D. un restaurante. Labora en el comedor preparando los alimentos desD. las 6H00 am . Le dificulta en su sector L. delincuencia ya que un día unos clientes saliendo del local le robaron. Con L. ayuda del préstamo quiere comprar materiales para su comedor como platos ventilador y cosas varias. En un futuro desea poner una sucursal en otro lugar para expandirse y tener mas ingreso y que su hija termine L. universidad.
texts.en:
Catalina is 42 years old and lives in a peri-urban area, in El Fortín, Guayaquil.  She is separated and has two children aged 23 and 13.  One of her children is at university and the other is in high school.  Catalina's business is selling meals.

Catalina started her business ten years ago.  She used to sell from a cart and then decided to open an eatery.  She previously used to work as a cook in a restaurant.  Catalina works in her eatery, preparing meals from 6.00am.  One of the problems she has in her neighborhood is crime.  One day some customers robbed her as they left her premises.

With the help of this loan, Catalina would like to buy supplies for her eatery such as plates, fans and other items.  In the future, she would like to set up a branch in another place so that she can expand and make more income.  She would also like her daughter to finish university.

loans.use: to buy plates and fans for her business

loans.name: Doris

texts.es: Doris tiene 46 años, está casada con cesar de 40 años. Juntos tienen 4 hijos y radican en la selva exótica de Pichari donde tienen su propia casa. Para Doris su único objetivo es salir adelante. Desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar mucho para poder ayudar a sus padres en el gasto familiar, es así que empezó vendiendo los productos que cosechaban sus padres logrando obtener su primer salario. Hoy tiene su propio terreno en donde siembra cacao, y esto es gracias por el apoyo de sus padres y las enseñanzas que lo dieron durante su adolescencia. Ahora lo que más prioriza es tener otro terreno agrícola para poder expandir la siembra de cacao. Sin embargo no deja de cumplir con las obligaciones de madre que tiene, es así que luego de realizar los quehaceres de la casa, ella junto a su esposo se enrumba a cultivar cacao sobre 5 hectáreas de terreno que posee. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para que pueda intensificarse en la producción del cacao. Doris está feliz con todos los de su banco comunal, porque todos  son muy optimistas. Con los 1.500 soles que solicita, lo invertirá en el mantenimiento de su parcela de cacao.
texts.en:
Doris, 46, is married to Cesar, 40. They have four children and live in the exotic Pichari jungle where they have their own house.  Doris’s only objective is to get ahead. From a very young age she’s had to work hard to help her parents with family expenses.  She, therefore, started out selling products harvested by her parents.  

Today, she has her own field where she grows cocoa beans, thanks to the teachings and support she got from her parents during her youth.  Her main priority now is to have another field to expand her cocoa bean crops.  However, she does not fail to meet the responsibilities she has as a mother so, after doing her household chores, she and her husband go out to farm the cocoa beans she has planted on the 5 hectare field she owns.

This will be her second MFP loan so she hopes to have support from each one of you so that she can intensify her cocoa bean production.  Doris is happy with all her fellow communal bank members because they are all very optimistic.  She will use the requested 1500 new soles to care for her cocoa bean field.

loans.use: to hire field hands and to buy fertilizer for her cocoa been plants.

loans.name: Momela Group

texts.en:
Justine, who is in his early twenties, is married with one baby girl. For the past five years, he has been running a general store where he sells charcoal, fruits, and vegetables. Justine works from six in the morning through ten at night and is able to make a fair monthly profit. He will share this loan with his loan group “Momela,” which has 15 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

Justine is requesting his sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use this loan to increase his store’s inventory of charcoal, fruit, and vegetables. Justine used his previous loans to start his business and to provide for household and medical expenses. He has successfully repaid all of his previous loans. Justine's dream is to buy land one day.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal, fruit, and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Virgen De Guadalupe De Santa Clara Group

texts.es: Yrene es una mujer soltera D. 36 años con una sola hija, y pertenece  a un nuevo grupo llamado Virgen D. Guadalupe D. Santa Clara, con 8 integrantes, son personas creativas y empeñosas en sus propios trabajos. Yrene  tiene su negocio D. ventas D. abarrotes y gaseosas hace 2 años, todo empezó vendiendo golosinas en una carpa afuera D. su casa, también comparte el negocio con la venta D. ropa a pedidos y productos D. belleza, hasta ahora ha logrado darle educación a su hija y ha hecho la compra D. su refrigeradora para su negocio, con el reciente préstamo piensa en invertir en la compra D. mas productos para su bodega.
texts.en: Yrene is a 36-year old single woman who has only one daughter. She belongs to a new, 8-member group called Virgen D. Guadalupe D. Santa Clara. They are creative and hardworking people who invest themselves in their respective businesses. Yrene has had a grocery store and soft drinks business for the past 2 years. She started out selling snacks from a stand outsiD. her house. As a part of her business she also sells clothing based on orders and beauty products. Her success to date has been her daughter's education and the purchase of a refrigerator for her business.  With this new loan she will invest in the purchase of more products for her store.

loans.use: to purchase general store products.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen, a 43-year-old married man with five children, lives in a permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. The responsibility of looking after his family is vested in him and his dream is to educate his children.

Stephen has operated a retail shop for 20 years. His major challenge has been constant price fluctuations which affect demand for his products. His dream is to own a wholesale shop. Stephen needs this loan to buy sacks of sugar, maize flour, cassava flour and soap to sell.

loans.use: To buy sacks of sugar, maize flour, cassava flour and soap to sell.

loans.name: Njete C Shg Group

texts.en:
Albert is the facilitator for Njete C Self Help Group.  This group has five members. This is the group's second year with One Acre Fund and the group is planning to re-enroll for the 2012 program.  

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important farming inputs to distribute to Albert and his group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

Albert joined One Acre Fund in order to acquire new farming skills, access quality inputs, generate additional profits from harvest, and feed his families. With income from his harvest, Albert plans to pay for his children's school fees, repair his home, create savings, and purchase livestock. Each Njete C SHG member has signed up for 2012 input loans for 1/2 acre plots.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Madame Fatou   est âgée  de 38 ans. Elle vit au Sénégal.  Sa principale activité consiste à vendre tissus, parfums, chaussures et savons. Elle a une expérience de 2 ans dans son  activité de commerce.  Elle l’a choisi par opportunité dans le  but de lutter  contre l’oisiveté. Elle est sociétaire dans l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis mai 2011. Elle sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour le redémarrage  de son activité  qui avait connu un arrêt  pendant une longue durée. Ce financement lui permettra de disposer de revenus  et résoudre certains problèmes  personnels.
texts.en:
Ms. Fatou is 38 years old. She lives in Senegal. Her main work involves selling cloth, perfumes, footwear, and soaps. She has two years of experience in her business, which she chose by chance in the struggle against idleness. 

She has been an associate of a U-IMCEC branch since May 2011 and is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs for starting up her business again, since it experienced a long suspension of activity. This financing will enable her to have an income and to resolve certain problems of hers.

loans.use: to buy cloth, perfumes, shoes, and soaps to resell

loans.name: Kristi Colleen

texts.en: Kristi Colleen, a hardworking entrepreneur who has operated an Internet cafe business in the Philippines for four years, is requesting a loan of PHP 29500 through NWTF to purchase an additional computer and spare parts for her enterprise.  Kristi Colleen, who earns additional income from buying and selling of imported products (lotion, perfumes, etc.) has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional computer and spare parts for maintenance.

loans.name: Mỹ Lệ's Group

texts.en:
Mỹ Lệ is a 23-year-old female living in the town of Yen Phong district - Bac Ninh province.  Mỹ Lệ is the group leader of a four member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Cụm Đông nhóm 03.


Mỹ Lệ is married and has one infant. To making a living, Mỹ Lệ owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale.  Mỹ Lệ has been engaged in this business for over five years, and earns approximately 5000000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2010, Mỹ Lệ joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Mỹ Lệ has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5152000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6944000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.  The loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Mỹ Lệ from SEDA.  Mỹ Lệ plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Ninh is a 38-year-old male who is requesting a 5152000 VND loan to support his business in the agriculture sector raising livestock and buying food for pigs.


2.  Chi is a 28-year-old female who is requesting a 6944000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock pigs and chickens.


3.  Chắt is a 25-year-old female who is requesting a 6944000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture making business production of tables and chairs.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Dynamique Group

texts.fr: LWAMIRA Pélagie est présidente du groupe de crédit dynamique , cliente au 7eme cycle de crédit, mariée, mère de trois enfants dont le dernier est en première année de graduat  et 2 sont déjà mariés. Elle vend des articles divers notamment des couvertures, draps, des ustensiles de cuisine…Elle commença son commerce en 1997 avec l’aide de son mari  en vendant des légumineuses (haricot, petit poids…). Elle sollicite un crédit de 300$ pour renforcer son chiffre d’affaire en achetant une quantité importante d’ustensiles de cuisine, des couvertures…Elle remercie l’IMF HEKIMA pour les crédits qu’elle reçoit sans garantie matérielle car elle a pu scolarisée tous ces trois enfants et elle projette acheter une parcelle dans l’avenir.
texts.en:
LWAMIRA Pélagie is the president of the loan group Dynamique, She is a client on her seventh loan cycle and the married mother of three children. The last-born is a first-year graduate student, and the two of the children are already married. 

Pélagie sells a variety of items, notably blankets, bed sheets, kitchen utensils.... She started this business in 1997, with her husband's help, by selling legumes (beans, peas...) 

She is requesting a loan of $300 to bolster her sales by buying a major quantity of kitchen utensils, blankets.... 

Pélagie thanks the micro-finance institution HEKIMA for the loans she receives without needing collateral because she was able to provide schooling to all her children. She plans on buying a parcel of land in the future.

loans.use: kitechen utensils, blankets....

loans.name: Kiseve

texts.en:
Kiseve is a focused business man, aged 39. He is married and blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. He has been selling clothes for the last seventeen years to support his family. He also runs a retail shop to supplement his income. In the next 5 years, he plans to expand his business. He dreams of managing a wholesale business in the future. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to access loans to boost his business. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 Kenya shillings to add to his stock of clothes for resale.

loans.use: To add to his stock of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
Carmencita is married with five children. She is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is a farmer who grows corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for 6 years. She has requested a loan of 7000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy commercial fertilizer for her corn. 

Carmencita has been a member of PMPC for years. In the future, Carmencita hopes to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy commercial fertilizer for her corn

location.town: Ozamis-Sangay Daku, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Jeana

texts.en:
Jeana is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 
Jeana has a shop where she sells snacks, bread and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy more stock.
Jeana has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jeana hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, bread and beverages.

loans.name: Brigitte

texts.en: Brigitte is 36 years old and has two children who are four and eight years old. Both children are in school. She owns a restaurant, which she has been running for five years. Brigitte would like a loan to buy rice, potatoes, bananas, and other foodstuffs to use in her restaurant. Any profits from the business will be used to buy a house. In the future, she would like to run a bar.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs to use in the restaurant.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel, 21 years old, is a single man. He has no children yet. He describes himself as an industrious and committed man. He provides transportation services using his taxi. The business customers are employees in an industrial area and residents. His business faces a challenge of the rising cost of fuel. 

He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy home products for a retail kiosk, as he wants to venture into the retail business. In the future, Daniel hopes and dreams to own many more taxis and to operate a bigger shop.

loans.use: To buy home products to start up a new retail business.

loans.name: Esperanza De Los Angeles

texts.es:
La señora Esperanza de los Ángeles  es una señora trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de Aguas fresca de horchata, Jamaica, naranja, coco, limón y tamarindo.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor Lorenzo con quien tiene  un hijo  por quien los dos trabajan para darles un mejor futuro ya que desean   que estudie.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de  frutas, azúcar y leche, para la elaboración de aguas frescas naturales.
Le dan las gracias a fundación por el apoyo que le ha dado para salir adelante y triunfar en el futuro.
texts.en:
Esperanza de Los Angeles is a hardworking woman who has a business selling "aguas frescas" (freshly made traditional Mexican beverages), including horchata (a rice-based beverage), jamaica (a type of iced-tea), and juices flavored with orange, coconut, lemon and tamarind.

Esperanza is happily married to Lorenzo, and together they have a child for whom they work hard to provide a better future, since they want him to get an education.  

Esperanza requested this loan to purchase fruit, sugar and milk to make her natural beverages.

She thanks the Fundación for the support that they have provided her, which will allow her to get ahead and succeed in the future.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make fresh beverages made from natural grains and fruit

loans.name: Nhuong's Group

texts.en:
Ms. Nhuong is 48 years old with one son. Being a farmer, she focuses on growing cherry blossoms and raising chickens for eggs. Her business started eight years ago and creates a good income for her to manage her family life. Currently, she wants to have a loan of 8,502,000 Vietnam dong to buy feed for her chickens.

Ms. Huyen is 26 years old with two children. She is raising chickens for eggs and growing cherry blossoms. She wants to have a loan of 5,014,000 Vietnam dong to buy food and fertilizer

Mr. Khoi is 22 years old. He is a driver. He wants to have a loan of 8,502,000 to repair his car.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is a 36-year-old married woman with two children, ages 8 and 10. For the past year, she has run an M-pesa transaction service which is a cell phone-based money transfer service. Everlyne describes herself as social and focused. Her business is located in a conducive environment and her primary customers are local residents and passersby. Everlyne's business challenge is inadequate float. 

Everlyne is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to increase her transaction capital. She will deposit her loan in a Safaricom account. Everlyne's business goal is to run three similar businesses within the next five years.

loans.use: to increase her money transfer service

loans.name: Mahugnon Group

texts.fr: MAHUGNON est un groupe est composé de quatre personnes qui résident dans la même zone. Chantal, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 34 ans n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Chantal est mariée à un certain Alphonse. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Chantal vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont supportées par Chantal et son mari. Chantal vend des pâtes alimentaires, du riz et des bois de chauffage de façon ambulante depuis huit ans.Chantal  s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Chantal sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUGNON dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle.

loans.use: Acheter des pâtes alimentaires, du riz et des bois de chauffage.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
This is Diana, a professional hairdresser. She is a 30 years old, married and has no children at the moment. She has been operating the salon business for seven years and has employed two people. She has five apprentices. Diana and her husband have been working hard to expand her business by opening another salon.
 
Diana needs this loan to purchase a washing sink for her new salon. This will enable her to complete the new salon and increase her income. She believes that in years to come, she will be able to train more young entrepreneurs and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy a washing sink for her salon

loans.name: Rina

texts.es:
La socia Rina se sigue dedicando a sus estudios en la universidad,ella trabaja en un tienda donde vende ropa, la socia es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora y por medio de su trabajo quiere terminar sus estudios ya que es su sueño ser profesional.La socia solicita el credito para comprar un equipo de sonido para su casa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cu
texts.en:
Rina is still studying at university. She is a hardworking and tenacious woman who wishes to finish her studies through her work. She is asking for a loan to purchase a sound system for her house. 

The member is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: to purchase a sound system for her house.

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah, 40, is a small-scale farmer who specializes in mixed farming. She is based in a small village called Kiptuiya, near Nandi Hills, Kenya. This charming mother has been doing agriculture on her small, fertile piece of land for five years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and crops.

Dinah is seeking a loan to buy more land and expand her farm. Her biggest challenge over the years as a farmer has been the lack of adequate capital. It is very hard for small farmers to save enough capital for expansion, since farming is marred with all sorts of external risks, such as climatic conditions, pests and diseases, political instability, fluctuation of prices, and high costs of inputs. Because of these factors, the sure way farmers can obtain adequate capital is through leveraging their businesses.

With your loan investment, Dinah is going to expand her farm in order to increase its output. If and when the investment pays off, Dinah will plough the profits back into the farm and increase her asset base.

loans.use: to buy land and expand her farm.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets tired to support for her family. Recently, she availed a loan to purchase bags of animal feeds. Aside from her project of concreting the pig pens, she thought of adding heads of pigs for commercial sale. Someday she hopes to open a meat shop in nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feeds

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis and his wife sell clothing. They have set up a part of their home as a store for their clients to come and visit. During the day, Luis travels to the rural sector of Ecuador in his truck offering his products in the small towns. While he is away, his wife sells the clothing from her home. Luis started selling clothes after losing a job he held in a large company for about 15 years. He bought his a used truck and started investing all of his savings. He now needs the loan because he wants to buy shoes for men and women. HE is 65 years old and has had 2 children with his wife.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in men and women\\\'s shoes

loans.name: Heran Kor

texts.en:
Heran Kor, who is Indian-Afghan and a citizen of Afghanistan, lives in district 2 of Kabul. She is 33 and married.

Heran Kor was taught knitting and embroidery from her grandmother and has continued her business from her. She took a loan to improve her business and buy thread, scarfs and a machine.

She said: 'I have had lots of customers during this period and I believe that I can produce the best quality with new designs in the bazaar. Because of that my clients and neighbours want to buy my work.'

She does not have enough materials - otherwise she would open a shop in her alley - but she hopes to receive a 2nd cycle loan so she can open a new shop.

loans.use: Buying Materials

loans.name: Chim

texts.en: Mrs. Chim E. is 69 years old and lives with her husband and 11 children in Kampong Cham, Cambodia.  Chim and her husband are farmers and own a plantation where they grow rubber trees.  They have 11 children, all of whom help them on the rubber tree plantation.  From their plantation, they are able to make about $25 per day.  They hope to use this loan for two purposes.  First, they want to repair their house so that it does not leak during the rainy season.  Additionally, they hope to purchase more seeds in order to grow more rubber trees.  In the future, the family hopes to purchase more land so that they can expand their rubber plantation.

loans.use: To repair house (to protect it from leaking during rainy season) and to purchase seeds to grow rubber trees

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Business Description

Carlos has 15 years of experience in shoe making and repair. He started out as an apprentice and learned the trade until he decided to start his own business. His savings allowed him to buy the necessary equipment. He works every day of the week from 8:00 AM until 6:30 PM in a rented space near his home.

Loan Use

He will use the loan proceeds to purchase supplies to manufacture sandals and to perform maintenance on his equipment. He also plans to purchase a display fixture for the shoes.

Personal Information

Carlos is 29 years old, is married and has two children. His wife is a homemaker and helps with the business as time allows. Their home is made of reeds. He hopes to be able to improve their home and provide a better life for his family as his business expands.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Carlos tiene una experiencia de 15 años en su actividad. Se inicio trabajando para un maestro de su sector. Con el que adquirió el conocimiento y decide poner su propio local. Sus ahorros le sirvieron para adquirir herramientas de trabajo. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 8:00 a.m. hasta las 6:30 p.m. Actualmente el local que posee es arrendado cerca de su domicilio.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en compra de materia prima para elaborar sandalias. Además de darle mantenimiento a sus herramientas de trabajo. Piensa comprarse una percha para poder exhibir sus productos.

Información Personal

Carlos es casado. Tiene 29 años y 2 hijos. Su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar. Y en sus ratos libres le ayuda con la atención del negocio. Su casita es de caña. Espera con la inversión realizada poder adecuar su domicilio . Dando de esta manera una mejor vida a su familia.

loans.use: To purchase supplies

loans.name: Saniyem

texts.id:
Saniyem has 3 grown-up children and although some are already married, she is not freed of her responsibility because they are still living with and dependent on her. She is burdened with the responsibilities of her family. But currently, she managed her store diligently since 1996 sufficient to support the daily-required expenses of Rp 35.000 – Rp 40.000 (approximately USD4). With the load from DINARI of Rp 10.000.000 (about USD1,100), she plan to fund a restaurant for her son, Slamet because he has not had a permanent job. Besides that her home is strategic location for a restaurant. With an approximate profit of Rp 35.000 – Rp 40.000 daily from a capital of Rp 200.000.

Translated from Indonesian to English By Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Mempunyai 3 orang anak yang sudah besar-besar dan sebagian sudah menikah bukan berarti bebas tanggungan, buktinya ketiga anaknya tersebut masih tinggal dan menggantungkan hidup mereka bersama Saniyem. sehingga tanggungan atau beban keluarganya cukup banyak.Tetapi saat ini usaha warung yang telah ditekuninya sejak tahun 1996 cukup membantu memenuhi kebutuhan sehari-harinya sebesar Rp.35.000 - Rp.40.000.Dan modal yang diterima dari DINARI sebesar Rp.10.000.000.- rencananya akan dibuatkan sebuah warung makan untuk anaknya yang bernama Slamet, karena sampai saat ini anaknya tersebut belum mempunyai usaha yang tetap. Disamping itu tempat tinggal Saniyem cukup strategis untuk dibuka usaha warung makan. Dengan perkiraan keuntungan Rp.35.000 - Rp.40.000 perhari dengan modal Rp.200.000.

loans.use: Purchase household necessities/supplies (Membeli bahan-bahan pokok kebutuhan rumah tangga)

loans.name: Roman

texts.en:
Roman is a low-income, vulnerable person. He is 27 and lives in Saatli town in the south-central flat area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. Roman rents a small shop in the local bazaar of Saatli town and sells food. The business is very successful but needs some investment to increase the daily turnover.

Roman has no collateral to use in applying to the commercial banks. That's why he applied to Normicro's Saatli branch for a US$ 500 loan. This loan would allow him to buy and sell bigger amount of goods and to provide better the necessities of life of his parents.

loans.use: To increase the variety of his inventory

loans.name: Delia Dalila

texts.es:
Delia is 41 years old and takes care of her 2 children. She studied up until the fourth year of secondary school, and she lives in the district of La Esperanza. She sells plastics, china plates, clothing, slippers, etc, often by the request of people she knows. She not only sells her products in the different villages in the foothills of La Libertad, but also around the city of Trujillo. Delia is a member of the communal bank called Mujeres Valerosas, which provided her first loan of approximately $100 to launch her business. With the new loan, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy more china plates, summer clothing, and Christmas novelties to sell during the holiday season. She would like to secure her own stand in a well known central market, so she doesn't have to sell her products in the street.

La señora Delia tiene 41 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos que aun están a su cargo. Estudió hasta el cuarto año de secundaria, vive en el Distrito de La Esperanza de la Provincia de Trujillo del Departamento de La Liberad y actualmente se dedica al comercio ambulatorio; vende plásticos, platos de loza, ropa, zapatillas, etc., muchos de éstos son pedidos que le hacen sus conocidos, a parte recorre diferentes pueblos de la sierra de La Libertad para vender sus productos y también diferentes zonas de la ciudad de Trujillo. La señora Delia es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Valerosas”, en él obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/.300.00 (aproximadamente $100), este préstamo le sirvió para poder surtir su negocio. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/.1,000.00 (aproximadamente $335), el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará platos de loza, ropa de verano y adornos navideños para vender en esta temporada de fiestas navideñas. La señora Delia anhela tener un puesto en un centro comercial conocido y así evitar vender por las calles.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE CHINA PLATES, CLOTHING AND CHRISTMAS NOVELTIES TO SELL AND GROW HER BUSINESS

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es:
Feliciano is a generous and involved father, ever since he left his home town of Capachica with his family of 6 children and his beloved wife. He has decided that with what little savings he has, he would buy a tricycle from which he could sell items throughout the district of Juliaqueña. This work which has taken much hard work and diligence to succeed and begins at 4am and lasts until 6pm. However, it has allowed him to take care of his household needs, even if it isn't yet enough to send his children to higher education. Feliciano and his wife Hilda, who knits beautiful chompas, or sweaters, would like to purchase a larger bicycle to outfit it from which to sell sweets, cookies and a wide variety of drinks. With the earnings they will make, they would like to pay for the higher education of their 6 children. Your help is very important in accomplishing the goals of this father.

Translated from Spanish to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Feliciano, es una voluntarioso y comprometido padre, desde que salió de su pueblo natal Capachica en compañía de su familia integrada por sus seis hijos y su querida esposa. Decidió adquirir con el poco ahorro que tenía un triciclo, a fin de brindar servicio de movilidad a la población Juliaqueña.Esta labor que desempeña con mucho esfuerzo y diligencia desde las 4:00 de la mañana hasta las 6:00 de la tarde, le ha permitido cubrir las necesidades de su hogar, pero aún no es suficiente para pagar los estudios superiores que dentro de poco tiempo seguirán sus hijos.Con el fin de generar ingresos extras don Feliciano y su esposa Hilda, que está dedicada al tejido de hermosas chompas, tienen pensado adquirir un triciclo de carga y adecuarlo para ofrecer y vender golosinas, galletas y una inmensa variedad de bebidas, con las ganancias que obtengan cubrir los gastos de estudios que demandan sus seis queridos hijos.“Tu ayuda es muy importante para cumplir los objetivos de este responsable padre”

loans.use: To purchase a bicycle to outfit and sell cookies, caramels and drinks.

loans.name: I Komang Dera

texts.id:
I Knomang Dera, 47 year old owns rice shell (side product of rice milling) trading business which he has been working on for the past 2 years. He picked this business since he is determined to improve his family's financial situation and to afford higher education for his children. In his village, most of the women own pig farms. One of the most popular pig feed is rice shell. Seeing an opportunity, I Komang Dera took the risk to start rice shell trading business at his home. With his saving, I Komang Dera purchased rice shell from rice mills and resell it to women in his village.

Because of his competitive pricing and good uality, I Komang Dera can sell 1 ton of rice shell per week with purchase price of 16 cents per kilogram and resale price of 17 cents. So each week he managed to get $10 profit. All of the earnings are used to fulfill his family's daily needs and saved for his children's future higher education tuition needs

I Komang Dera wants to improve his business. He needs loan to purchase more rice shell to improve his earnings. I Komang Dera is very diligent in his business because of his view that all he does will benefit his family.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

I Komang Dera, 47 tahun, mempunyai usaha jual beli dedak padi. Usaha ini sudah ditekuni sejak 2 tahun lalu. Pekerjaan ini diambilnya karena ia ingin meningkatkan perekonomian keluarganya sehingga ia akan mampu membiayai pendidikan anaknya setinggi mungkin. Tinggal di lingkungan pedesaan, sebagian besar kaum wanitanya mempunyai usaha beternak babi. Salah satu pakan yang sangat dibutuhkan adalah dedak padi. Melihat peluang ini, I Komang Dera memberanikan diri untuk membuka usaha jual beli dedak padi dirumahnya. Dengan modal tabungannya, I Komang Dera membeli dedak padi di penggilingan padi dan menjualnya kembali ke ibu – ibu di desanya. Karena harga yang bersaing dan kwalitas dedak yang baik, I Komang Dera mampu menjual dedak padi sebanyak 1 tons per minggu dengan harga beli per kilogramnya adalah Rp. 1.500.- dan dijual kembali dengan harga Rp. 1.600.- Jadi dalam seminggu ia bisa mendapatkan keuntungan Rp. 100.000.- Semua keuntungan itu ia pergunakan untuk kebutuhan keluarganya sehari – hari dan juga ditabung untuk persiapan biaya pendidikan anaknya. I Komang Dera ingin meningkatkan usaha agar lebih maju lagi. Ia memerlukan pinjaman dana untuk dapat membeli lebih banyak lagi dedak padi sehingga ia bisa meningkatkan keuntungannya. I Komang Dera sangat tekin dalam usahanya karena ia mempunyai prinsip bahwa semua yang dilakukannya sekarang adalah untuk keluarganya.

loans.use: Rice shell trading

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence I. sells clothing and also sews for people. She is married with 5 children and is 44 years old. She spent 3 years learning her business and has been in business since 1995. She needs the loan amount of $450 to buy wrapper for sale.

loans.use: To buy wrapper for sale

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is 29 years old and has one child. He lives with his family in southern Lebanon, in the town of Saida. Ahmad makes a living by running a grocery store. He has applied for his first loan from Al Majmoua, and he would like to use the funds to buy additional merchandise to sell to his customers.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in his grocery store

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana has always wanted to offer more to her loved ones. Her vegetables have been very successful and have give a good harvest thanks to her care, and she hopes to have a similar harvest this year. This is why she is soliciting a loan, and with it acquire bulk quantities of fertilizer and minerals.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

Ana, siempre quiso dar lo mejor a sus seres queridos. Sus vegetales gracias al cuidado que le otorga le han dado excelentes frutos la cosecha pasada y espera tener una cosecha similar este año. Por ese motivo solicita un préstamo a fin de adquirir mayor cantidad de abonos y fertilizantes.

loans.use: Purchase in bulk of minerals and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her business selling maize and gari.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina is a member of the Ccori Soncco Village Bank (meaning Gold Heart in Quechua, the native language of Peru).

Florentina is a married 53-year-old mother of four children. Florentina and her husband, a medical technologist, have a clinical analysis lab in a rented location. They have two other locations where they collect their samples and have other organizations help distribute their work. Florentina has recently taken over the administration of the three locations. Furthermore, Florentina on some occasions prepares cakes and sweets to order for her clients.

Florentina needs a loan of 3000 Peruvian Nuevo Soles ($1075 USD) to invest in chemical reagents.

Florentina’s dream is to proviD. an economically established environment for her children, that her children obtain professional jobs and that she will eventually be able to relax and learn more about Peru with her husband.

loans.use: Florentina needs a loan to invest in chemical reagents.

loans.name: Dinna

texts.en:
Dinna is a 24-year-old married woman with one child, aged 2 years. She sells clothes and shoes. Every day, she works from 6am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $US225.

Dinna now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes and shoes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more inventory

loans.name: Mr. Youn Im Village Bank Group

texts.en:
ElevE. people in Thlork Roling Village in Kampong Chhnang Province are involved in a village bank loan. Mr. Youn I. is the village bank president and a firewood merchant in the local village. Since his business is going well, he is requesting a loan to buy more fire wood to re-sell. His wife, Mrs. Hao Sary, raises two cows and thirty chickens. Aside from this business, she owns a small rice mill which brings in some income as well. Mr. Youn I. is 37 years old and the father of four childrE. who are all attending school. Mrs. Mich S. does not come to take a loan, but her husband requests a loan; therefore, she is shown in the picture.
This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Eight members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more fire wood to re-sell.

loans.name: Kumba

texts.en:
Kumba S. is a businesswoman in Kabala. She sells provisions, shirts, rubbers, jewelry, and more. She was born in Kabala 28 years ago. She is single and has two children, one in primary school and the other in nursery school.

This loan will be Kumba's fifth from SMT. Previous loans were a great blessing to this lady. They enabled her business to grow a great deal. Out of the proceeds she makes, she can feed and clothe herself, her children, and her parents. She is very thankful to Kiva for supporting her business.

Kumba is now requesting a loan of Le 3,500,000.00 to further strengthen her business. With this loan, she is sure that her income will definitely increase to a new height. With more profit, she will be able to do a lot of good things for herself as well continue to take good care of her aging parents, her children, and herself.

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Mr. Phearak Pang Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The members of this group live in the village of Preak Samraong Village in Kandal province, and they are seeking a loan for various business purposes.

Mr. Phearak P. is the group's leader. He is a 23-year-old fisherman who is unable to catch fish because he does not have enough fishing equipment. To address this problem, Mr. Phearak P. is seeking a loan to buy a new boat and fish nets to re-start his business. His wife, Mrs. Chhoeurn Nary, is employed in a garment factory, and she earns a small salary to support their household. They have a 1-year-old child who is too young to work or study.

In practice, this is a group loan, but the loans are structured in two ways: four members are seeking end-of-term loans, while the rest of the group's members would like monthly payment loans. With respect to the end-of-term loans, the borrowers are not required to repay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. Notably, end-of-term loans are AMK's main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor population. Specifically, such loans allow borrowers to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Even so, most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term, and nearly all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. In fact, AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09%, and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva loans.

loans.use: To revamp his business by purchasing a new boat and fish nets

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es: El señor Vicente es una persona D. mediana edad, esta casado con L. señora Susana, los dos son personas muy responsables y trabajadores, ellos están solicitando este crédito para L. construcción D. un techo tipo cochera, para proteger su automóvil del granizo y D. L. lluvia.
texts.en:
Vicente is a middle-aged man, he is married with his wife, Susana, and they are both very responsible and hard working people. They are requesting a loan to build the roof over a car port, to protect their car from hail and rain.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install the roof over a car port.

loans.name: Guapuru Group

texts.es: EL GRUPO "GUAPURÚ" ESTA REPRESENTADO POR LA SEÑORA ANA. DENTRO DEL CUAL EXISTE UN PARENTESCO ENTRE ERICKA Y MIREYA ELLAS SON HERMANAS, PERO CADA UNA TIENE  INDEPENDENCIA ECONÓMICA Y SON TOTALMENTE INDEPENDIENTES. EN SU MAYORÍA LOS SOCIOS (AS) SE DEDICAN AL COMERCIO D. PRODUCTOS COMO CONFITES, PINTURA , PAN, ROPA, DOMÉSTICOS Y A LA PINTURA D. VIVIENDAS. DENTRO DEL MERCADO SIEMPRE EXISTE LA COMPETENCIA PERO LA EXPERIENCIA D. LAS SOCIAS PREDOMINA PARA CONTINUAR SIN PROBLEMAS. EL DESTINO DEL CRÉDITO ES PARA INCREMENTAR SUS PRODUCTOS Y MATERIALES A LA VENTA Y AL INCREMENTO D. INSUMOS PARA LA ELABORACIÓN D. PAN. DENTRO DEL GRUPO EXISTEN SOCIAS D. LAS CUALES NUNCA TRABAJARON CON GRUPOS SOLIDARIOS PERO TIENEN MUCHA RESPONSABILIDAD Y COMPROMISO CON SUS COMPAÑERAS D. GRUPO PARA SALIR ADELANTE TODOS JUNTOS.
texts.en:
Ana represents the 'Guaparú' group. Two of the group members, Ericka and Mireya are related (sisters), but each of them is economically independent and they are completely independent from each other. For the most part, the members sell products such as candy, paint, bread, clothing, and household supplies and offer house painting. In the marketplace there is always competition, but these members have no problem succeeding because of their experience. This loan will be used to increase the products and materials they have for sale, and to get more ingredients for making bread. Some members of the group have not worked with village banking groups before, but they are very responsible and committed to their partners so that everyone can come out ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Marguérite

texts.fr: Née à Dangbo; un petit village situé à près de 32 Km de la ville de Porto-Novo, la capitale politique du BENIN, dans le département de l'OUEME. A. Marguérite est âgée de 35 ans et est mariée à DASSI Fulbert un mécanicien de profession qui exerce son activité dans leur domicile. Mère d'une fille de 2 ans, A. Marguérite vend des habits pour enfants, des produits de beauté et de cheveux. A. Marguérite exerce cette activité depuis 17 ans. Elle est à son troisième crédit.
texts.en:
Born in Dangbo, a small village located about 32 km from the city of Porto-Novo, the political capital of BENIN, in OUEME County, Ms. Marguérite A. is married to Fulbert DASSI, a mechanic by trade who works at home. She is 35 years old and the mother of a 2-year-old girl. She sells children's clothing and beauty products and has been in this business for seventeen years. This is her third loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing and beauty products

loans.name: Luisa Lesvia

texts.es:
Doña Luisa Lesvia M. J. vive en el Municipio de Nejapa. Tiene  15 años de experiencia en la confección de  prendas de vestir y  ocho años de poseer su  propio negocio en el oficio de la costura a mano, lo que le de un toque de calidad y perfeccionismo a cada pieza que elabora con mucha dedicación. 

Sin embargo  doña Luisa desea   prosperar su negocio, elaborando más ropa  e incrementando de esta forma  sus ganancias.  Razón por la que ha solicitado a integral un préstamo que   desea invertir en capital de trabajo, lo que le permitirá  adquirir variedad de telas y colores que le solicitan sus clientes.
texts.en:
Luisa Lesvia Martinez J. lives in the municipality of Nejapa. She has 15 years' experience in fashioning articles of clothing and for the past 8 years she has had her own business in hand-made clothing, giving her articles a touch of quality and perfectionism to each and every piece she makes with special attention.

But Luisa wishes to make her business grow, making more clothing and therefore increasing this way her earnings. This is the reason why she has requested a loan which she wishes to invest as working capital, permitting her to acquire a variety of fabrics and different colors that her clients have requested.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials to fashion clothing.

loans.name: Livann

texts.en:
Mrs. Livann T., 39, has been married 15 years and has two children: a son and a daughter, both of whom attend school. She lives with her mother on an island in the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Livann has been a silk weaver for 20 years. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then sells them at the market in Phnom Penh. Her husband has full-time employment. Livann is requesting a loan of $500 to maintain the land around her house and to pay for house repairs.

loans.use: To maintain the land around her house and to pay for house repairs.

loans.name: Djahongir

texts.en:
Djahongir is 26 years old and lives with his wife and two children who are his main inspiration to continue working hard. He has been transporting passengers for 5 years and due to his sound money management he now owns a minivan which helps to increase his household income. What he enjoys most about his work is the direct contact he has with his passengers. His business is profitable because he is the driver and there is no need to pay an additional salary. This is his second loan with IMON International. Djahongir has proven himself to be punctual in his loan repayments. He will use the loan to buy one more minivan and will give his old minivan to his brother. In that way Djahongir will be able to improve the living conditions of his large family which includes his wife, children, parents and brother.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth  millennium BC.  Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve the agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase a new minivan

loans.name: Abdujabor

texts.en:
Abdujabor S. has been selling cattle for more than 20 years. This has helped him move on in his business. He's the father of two children who he both needs to feed and provide with the necessary education. One of his main needs is the need to purchase cattle in order to improve his business. For this reason Abdujabor went to IMON International and requested a loan of US $800. Not only will his business benefit from it, so will his family. Your support will really help him.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Fumilola

texts.en:
Fumilola styles hair and she also sells hair extensions, drinks and water. She hopes for the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more hair extensions and drinks to sell.

Fumilola is 38 years old and married with three children. She promises to pay back her Kiva loan. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr:
G. Jeanne est âgée de quarante (40) ans. Jeanne est née à Cana dans la Commune d’Abomey dans le Département du Zou. Jeanne est divorcée et mère de trois (3) filles: Chantal, Sylvie et Lydie qui sont à sa charge. Jeanne vit avec ses enfants  à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin; dans le quartier Missessin. Jeanne vend depuis quinze (15) ans des produits cosmétiques, des fruits et des tubercules d’ignames. Depuis trois ans, Jeanne bénéficie des prêts à ALIDé ; prêts qu’elle a toujours bien remboursés. Jeanne sollicite encore de crédit auprès de ALIDé pour mieux développer son activité afin d’augmenter son revenu pour un mieux être de ses enfants.

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
G. Jeanne is 40 years old. She was born in Cana in the township of Abomey in the County of Zou. Jeanne is divorced and the mother of 3 daughters: Chantal, Sylvie, and Lydie, who are all still her responsibility. She lives with her children in Cotonou, economic capital of Benin, in the Missessin district.

For 15 years, Jeanne has been selling cosmetics, fruit, and cocoyams. For 3 years, Jeanne has been taking out loans at ALIDé and has always correctly reimbursed them. She is requesting another loan from ALIDé to use to develop her business further so that she can do better by her children.

The significance of ALIDé in the local language of Benin, Fon, is "there is always a pathway for the poorest of the poor". Benin is a small country in West Africa next door to Nigeria, where the average per capita income stands at US$ 1,500.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of body milks, toilet soaps, sacks of fruit and cocoyams

loans.name: El Pari Group

texts.es: Las socias del grupo "El Pari"  presentan  como parentesco familiar a la señora Evelin y a la señora Katherine ellas son hermanas con ingresos totalmente diferentes uno D. la otra, D. igual forma el señor Juna y la señora AyD. ambos también hermanos con ingresos independientes. Las socias D. este banco en su gran mayoría se dedican a la venta D. ropa, cosméticos y productos D. belleza por catálogos, ropa, celulares y productos al por mayor. Como en todo rubro comercial siempre existe la competencia D. la oferta y la demanda pero los socios cuentan con experiencia para salir adelante. Este crédito esta destinado para la compra D. mayor cantidad D. productos para poder competir en el mercado pudiendo así generar mayores ingresos para mejorar la calidad D. vida D. sus familias. Los socios van cursando su segundo ciclo demostrando capacidad para la administración D. fondos y para obrar con un grupo responsable y unido.
texts.en:
The members of the El Pari group have family ties with Evelin and Katherine, sisters who have incomes that are totally different from each other. The same is true for Juna and AyD., sisters with independent incomes. The majority of the members of this bank sell clothes, cosmetics, beauty products by catalog, cell phones, and wholesale products. As in all businesses, there is always some competition with supply and demand, but the group members have the experience to get ahead. This loan is to buy a greater quantity of products to be able to compete in the market. This way they will be able generate greater income to improve the quality of life for their families. The members are in their second loan cycle. They are demonstrating their capacity to administer funds and to work as a responsible, united group.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Doris Nicole

texts.es: Doris Nicole Q. C. vive en San Cristóbal  ubicado en el departamento de Cuscatlán. Doris es madre soltera de 4 hijos entre ellos Kimberly de 18 años, Kevin de 13 años, Henry de 11 años y Yaneth  de 10 años de edad, todos los niños se encuentran estudiando. Doris se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y su producto más vendido y demandado son los perfumes , Doris vende de manera ambulante viajando a los municipios de los alrededores, sus clientes obtienen el beneficio de comprarle a Doris, ya que ella da los perfumes al crédito y el dinero ella los recupera en el transcurso de un mes. Doria solicita un crédito para comprar perfumes que se encuentran en oferta de esta manera lograra incrementar su margen ganancia.
texts.en:
Doris Nicole Q. C. lives in San Crístobal, in the Cuscatlán region of El Salvador. Doris is a single mother of 4; Kimberly is 18, Kevin is 13, Henry is 11 and Yaneth is 10. All of the children attend school.
Doris sells cosmetics and her best-selling and most in demand products are the perfumes. Doris works as a street vendor travelling to neighbouring towns. Her customers benefit from her offering the perfumes on credit and collecting payment a month later.
Doris is requesting a loan to purchase perfumes that are on sale so that she can increase her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase discount perfumes

loans.name: Susana Rosario

texts.en:
Susana is a member (and the official treasurer) of the communal bank “Mujeres Perseverantes” (Persevering Women) and lives in the city of Pucallpa. She helped to found her communal bank about two-and-a-half years ago. Susana sells beauty products, undergarments and shoes through catalog orders. She devotes herself to this business in the afternoons and teaches kindergarten in the mornings. Although Susana dedicates a lot of time to her work as a teacher (including creating lesson plans in the evening), her salary is quite low. Teachers are not very well paid in Pucallpa. She is happy to have a business venture with which to supplement her income.

With this loan of 2500 soles Susana plans to purchase more products for sale. Loans have helped her to expand both the number of products she has on hand and her clientele. Susana also hopes to buy a display window for her goods. Additionally, she is considering purchasing a permanent post in the market from which to sell her goods rather than conducting her business from home.

Susana and her husband have four children, aged 17, 15, 13 and 4. Susana’s husband works as an accountant at a timber enterprise. Her eldest daughter, who is studying environmental engineering, occasionally helps her with her business. Susana is also helping this daughter with her own little business venture doing manicures and pedicures.

Susana told me that her business has been doing well; her credit has helped it to grow quite a bit. In this short video clip Susana talks about her goals of continuing to expand her business, helping women to look and feel good, and ensuring that her children get a good education.

video.title: Kiva Journal for Susana Rosario Vargas De Moreno from Peru

loans.use: More products for sale and a display case.

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr:
Ce monsieur est un tailleur, il jouit d’une très bonne réputation dans son quartier. Il voudrait acheter une nouvelle machine à pleinte pour exécuter et livrer à temps ses commandes.
Il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter une machine à pleinte, ainsi il pourra livrer rapidement ses commandes et en recevoir plus pour augmenter ses recettes.
Etant célibataire, le revenu de son activité lui permet de subvenir à ses propres charges et à celles de ses frères et sœurs.
texts.en:
This man is a tailor, who enjoys a very good reputation in his neighborhood. He would like to buy a new sewing machine to execute his orders on time. This is why he's seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES. This will enable him to execute orders faster and, therefore, to get more of them and to increase his profit. Being single, his income enables him to provide for himself and for his brothers and sisters.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Nemé

texts.fr: Cette femme vend des sacs de charbon de bois, ce qui lui permet de se prendre en charge et d’assurer l’éducation de son enfant. Elle est très connue à Agoè Zongo à Lomé où elle approvisionne tout le quartier et ses environs. Pour éviter une pénurie de charbon de bois, elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 10 sacs moyens de charbon de bois, 12 petits sacs de charbon de bois et assurer aussi les frais de transport vers le lieu d’approvisionnement. Cette femme n’est pas mariée.
texts.en:
This is a woman who sells sacks of charcoal, which enables her to care for and educate her child. She is well-known in Agoè Zongo in Lomé, where she supplies the entire district and surrounding areas. To prevent a shortage of charcoal, she’s requesting a loan from WAGES to buy ten mid-size sacks of charcoal and twelve small sacks and to ensure the costs are covered for the supply run. This woman is unmarried.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
"Epifania P. (0) is a 22 years-year-old woman living in the town of Samatau 3.  She is married and does not have any chlidren.  To make a living, Epifania owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a tailoring business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general  alteration & tailoring services to local community members.  Epifania has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 300 tala WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Epifania joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Epifania is requesting for the first time a loan from SPBD.    Epifania is now requesting a new loan of 1000 tala WST which will be used to purchase new sewing machine.  The loan will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Epifania plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand the borrower's business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: to purchase new sewing machine

loans.name: Warlita

texts.en:
Warlita C. is from the village of Danao. She is 65 years old. Warlita is married and has 7 adult-aged children. To make a living, Warlita owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of food products in the local community. Warlita has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 1999, Warlita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Warlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Warlita is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 17th loan taken out by Warlita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Mean

texts.en:
Mean K. is an older woman and the married mother of four children, three of whom are married and live separately and the other one attends school.

Mean K. has been engaged in a business weaving fishnets for more than ten years. She saves many pieces of net before selling them. Most of her clients come to buy her finished nets directly at her house.

Mean K. is 53 years old and married to Em Phear who assists her in making nets. Mean K. requests a loan to purchase more raw materials to continue weaving nets.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials for weaving nets

loans.name: Mary Nyaboke

texts.en:
Mary Nyaboke M. is 32 years old and has a home bakery business. She offers cakes, porridge and mandasi (a donut-like pastry). She sells to rural residents and casual laborers in her area. She has been in this business for seven years and struggles with not having a permanent spot to bake and sell her goods. She is using the proceeds from this loan to buy an oven and open a shop. She would ultimately like to open a general store offering fish from Tanzania and clothes from Uganda. 

Mary is married and her husband works at Akamba bus services. They have four children, ages 5 to 14 years old. Mary dreams of educating all her children to the university level and buying her own home.

loans.use: To purchase an oven and open a shop

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth A. is from the village of Bagontaas, Valencia City. She is 36 years old. Ruth is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Ruth owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from the buying and selling of herbal food supplements in the local community. Ruth has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Ruth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ruth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Ruth is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Ruth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Socheat

texts.en:
Mr. Socheat M. is a villager who lives in Boeng Tranh village in Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he cultivates rice. His wife, Mrs. Neang Khorn, is a garment factory worker who makes a small salary to support the family.

Although they try to work hard, they still earn less money than needed to support the family. In order to improve their living conditions, Mr. Socheat M. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding and he hopes to improve their standard of living with this loan.

Mr. Socheat M. is a father with two children who are both enrolled in the local school. His wife is shown in the photo with him.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline is 50 years old and married with seven children. She is a focused, hard worker. She is very determined to lift her business above poverty level. She sells bunches of plantain at retail prices to her customers.

She is a LAPO client. The Kiva field partner, LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization), is committed to improving lives in Nigeria. Roseline is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more bunches of plantain to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bunches of plantain to sell

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca D. L. D. R. D. 39 años D. edad, resiD. en Santiago Nonualco, departamento D. La Paz. Vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos menores D. edad los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Ella junto a su esposo poseen una venta D. productos lácteos en su propia casa, lo cual les generan buenas ganancias lo cual les permite solventar todos los gastos del hogar, a pesar D. esto, ellos desean poder construir un  garaje, lo cual no les es posible hasta la fecha, ya que las ganancias generadas no les ajusta para poder realizar este tipo D. trabajo en su casa. Es por esto que ellos solicitan un préstamo a través del cual puedan contar con el capital necesario para construirlo, esto con el fin D. tener más seguro el automóvil que posee, el cual lo utilizan para distribuir el queso con los diferentes clientes.
texts.en:
Francisca D. L. D. R. is 39 years old and lives in Santiago Nonualco, in the Department of La Paz. She lives with her husband and their two children, who are still young and attending school. Francisca and her husband operate a shop selling dairy products in their own home. The business generates a good income, allowing them to cover all of their household expenses. Nevertheless, they would like to build a garage, and this has not been possible until now, since the income from the business has not been sufficient to carry out this type of work in their home. For this reason, they are requesting a loan which will proviD. them with enough capital to construct the garage. Their aim is to proviD. better security for the car they own, which they use to distribute cheese to various customers.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building a garage

location.town: Santiago Nonualco, departamento de La Paz

loans.name: Máximo Primitivo

texts.es:
Máximo R. de 49 años, vive en la zona Paraíso de Guayaquil, su esposa trabaja con el con ella tiene 2 hijos uno de 17 años, y 10 años estudian en una escuela particular. 

Máximo empezó trabajando en un almacén de artículos varios años, con la liquidación que le dieron comenzó vendiendo arroz y verduras en su casa, poco a poco pudo poner una tienda. Ahora gracias a los buenos ingresos que a obtenido pudo poner unas cabinas telefónicas y artículos de bazar el trabaja todos de lunes a domingo vendiendo arroz, atún, aceites, servicio de telefonía etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar zapatos, ropa, maquillajes para poder surtir mejor su negocio. En el futuro quiere poner sucursales y poder así comprarse un auto para su familia.
texts.en:
Máximo R., age 49, lives in the Paraíso de Guayaquil neighborhood. His wife works with him. The pair have 2 children, ages 17 and 10, who attend a private school. Máximo began working in a wholesale grocer's shop. With the discount they gave him he began selling rice and vegetables from home. Little by little, he was able to set up a store. Now, thanks to the good income he has earned, he was able to install telephone booths and stock general goods. He works everyday, Monday to Sunday, selling rice, tuna, oils, telephone services, etc. With this loan he wants to buy shoes, clothing, and make-up to better stock his business. In the future he wants to start other branches of his business and thus be able to buy a car for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Shoes, clothing, rice

loans.name: Money Tree Group

texts.en: Marie C. is a leader of a group of five borrowers called Money Tree Group. She is 36 years old and is married with two children, ages 3 and 4. Both of them are in the nursery educational level. Marie and her family live in Gbange Town, but work around the V.O.A. gas station community in Monrovia, the capital of Liberia. She was never able to go to school herself due to lack of financial support from her parents. Marie’s business is the sale of food such as cassava, fufu, coconut and plantain. She buys her goods from wholesalers and sells retail to residents of the V.O.A. community in Monrovia. She has been running this business for five years and hopes to become both an importer and exporter of goods in the near future. Marie started selling with 500.00 Liberian Dollars in working capital, but now operates with about 8500.00 Liberian Dollars. She sells good products and also has a good working relationship with her customers in order to encourage them to continue buying from her. Marie will use this loan as working capital to improve her business. She dreams of getting her children educated and getting a house of her own. In the photo that accompanies this profile, Marie is the one holding the sign. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy cassava, fufu, coconut and plantain for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To restock his retail shop and pay his children's school fees

loans.name: Ekuah

texts.en: Ekuah F. sells foodstuffs such as plantain, cassava, palm oil and others at Abura.  Ekuah has received no educational background.  She is a widow and has five dependants. Ekuah has been selling foodstuffs for some time now. She is responsible for paying school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more foodstuffs for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to educate her children.
