Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, Western culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. Civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients have a solid business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy a generator

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther T. is 40 years old and married with four children. Esther sells foodstuffs like fish, garri, rice, and plantain. She hopes to expand this business. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders and LAPO Microfinance for their financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is 30 years old. He is single and lives in Khudat town. This man has been in the auto-repair business for three years. Now he needs a loan of 1500 AZN to buy spare parts and things necessary for repairing cars.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Bakhtiryar

texts.en:
Bakhtiryar Q. is 36 years old. He is married with three children. He is a small entrepreneur who sells different kinds of goods such as shampoos, detergents, and other items in his grocery store. Bakhtiryar is not alone in this business. His whole family actively helps him with sales.

Bakhtiryar has run this business for more than 15 years. With savings, he could grow and expand his business. Currently Bakhtiryar is requesting a loan of $1200 USD for a term of 15 months to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: To purchase more items to increase his stock

loans.name: Loik

texts.ru: Разоков Лоик житель района Шахринау.Возрат 36 лет, женат и имеет двоих детей. Работает слесарем на станции технического обслуживания. Работает уже пять лет. Его еятельность единственный источник дохода его семьи. Работает очень много. кредит планирует получить для того, чтобы купить инструменты и запчасти для автомобилей.
texts.en:
Loik R. lives in the Shahrinav district. He is 36 years old, married and has two children. He works as a technician at an auto service station. He has been in this business for five years. His business is the only source of income for his family. Loik works a lot. He plans to obtain this loan in order to purchase tools and auto parts. He plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of auto parts and tools

loans.name: Confiance Group

texts.fr:
Les six  membres du groupe Confiance sont toutes des femmes mariées  avec une moyenne d’âge de 37ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent dans des  familles monogames à Ouayerma I un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur huitième  prêt solidaire. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente de cartes de crédit pour téléphones,  de gingembre (pour la fabrication  de boissons locales non alcoolisées), de  condiments alimentaires et des brochettes de viande grillées.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter  25 cartes de crédit pour téléphones, 1 sac de sucre, 2 sacs de 100kg de gingembre, 3 colis de condiments alimentaires, 10 litres d’huile alimentaire, 5kg de viande , 5 sacs de charbon de bois.
Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans les localités avoisinantes. Les marchandises sont vendues dans les différents  marchés de Sikasso et dans les quartiers à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes et la plupart au comptant. 
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 12.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée en épargne et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Les femmes du groupe Confiance ambitionnent d’augmenter leur chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire leur clientèle.
texts.en:
The six members of the group Confiance are all married women who average 37 years of age and 4 children each. They live mainly in monogamous families in Ouayerma I, a district in Sikasso City (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy the needs of their customers and are now on their 8th solidarity loan. All the preceding loans were correctly repaid. The group members do a diversity of work, including selling mobile phone cards, ginger (for making local soft drinks), condiments, and grilled meat kebobs.

With this new loan, they intend to buy 25 mobile phone cards, one sack of sugar, two 100-kg sacks of ginger, three packages of condiments, ten liters of cooking oil, five kilos of meat, and five sacks of charcoal. Supplies are gotten at the grand marketplace of Sikasso City and in neighboring towns. The merchandise is sold, in mostly cash transaction, to customers composed of men and women at different marketplaces in the city and in the area.

The group members each envision realizing an average monthly profit of 12,500 franc CFA. A portion of the profits will put into savings, and the other portion will be invested in business. Their ambition is to increase their turnover, so as to satisfy their customers better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Mwanahamis

texts.en:
Mwanahamis is a tomato seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar. She belongs to Mapatano group loan (Group code 2070). She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $175. Every day she works at her business for eight hours.

She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more tomatoes for resale. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.

Mwanahamis is 36 years old, married, and has a 16-year-old child. She also cares for one additional dependent.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes for resale

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
Candelaria es socia del Bancomunal San Judas Tadeo
Candelaria es casada tiene 51 años, cinco hijos de 28, 24,22,14 y 11 años que esta  estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Candelaria trabajaba llevando desayuno al municipio a los trabajadores, pero le empezaron a deber y dejo el negocio, se puso a vender en su casa tamales y ha repartir casa por casa. Y los fines de semana prepara comida para vender. 
Desde que Candelaria esta en Finca aprendió como trabajar mejor en su negocio.
Candelaria necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para la compra de maíz, azúcar, aceite para preparar tamales.
El sueño de Candelaria es abrir un restaurante en su casa.
texts.en:
Candelaria is a member the communal bank San Judas Tadeo. Candelaria is married and she is 51 years old. She has five children ages 28, 24, 22 14 and 11 years old. The 11-year-old and 14-year-old children are students at a public school. Candelaria used to make a living by selling breakfast to city workers, but they started to owe her too much and she left this business. Then she started to sell tamales out of her house. She make home deliveries to her costumers and on the weekends she prepares a variety of foods to sell. Candelaria needs a loan of $425 to purchase corn, sugar and oil to prepare tamales. Candelaria's dream is to open a restaurant in her home.

(Translated by Mariela of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase corn, sugar and oil to prepare tamales.

loans.name: Sarmila

texts.en:
Sarmila S. is a resident of Thecho. Thecho is located in Lalitpur district and the majority of people living in this region are Newars. Thecho is one of the developing villages of Lalitpur and most of the people in this region are engaged in farming.

Sarmila has four members including herself in her family. She has one son and one daughter. Her son is studying in grade 4 and her daughter is in primary school.

Sarmila’s husband Mr. Dev Krishna opened his furniture shop a few years ago. He makes different types of furniture such as beds, racks, chairs, tables, doors, and windows, etc. He makes all this furniture according to orders from his customers. Nowadays he is receives lots of orders from his customers to make different types of furniture. But due to lack of money he cannot fulfill the orders of the customers.

So Mrs. Sarmila S. is requesting Rs 30,000 as a loan to help her husband to buy wood and other various raw materials to fulfill the orders for furniture from the customers.

loans.use: to buy wood for furniture-making

loans.name: Ana Rosa

texts.es:
Ana Rosa pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manuela de Hoy”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 20 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, no tiene hijos y tiene estudios de secundaria completa, vive en el Centro Poblado de Rosa Cani Sector Mamani Allachaya.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 1 año,  su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles el cual utilizó para la compra de ganado mayor. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 800.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de ganado menor (ovinos) ella los compra en las comunidades de la zonas, para luego venderlos en las ferias del lugar.

Su deseo es poder comprar mayor cantidad de ganado y poder vender al por mayor.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las reuniones de los Bancos Comunales.
texts.en:
Ana Rosa belongs to the "Manuela de Hoy" Village Bank, located in Ilave District of El Collao, Puno Department. She is 20 years old and single; she doesn't have any children. She has a high school education, and currently lives in Mamani Allachaya Sector of the Rosa Cani Community. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the past year. Her first loan was for 500 soles, which she used to buy livestock. She is currently requesting a loan of 800 soles to buy sheep in her local area, which she will later sell at area markets. She likes her savings accounts and her village bank meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sheep

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is married to Angelito A. and they are fortunately blessed with an only child named Owen Angelo. He is now 8 years old and is currently attending the elementary level of education. Her husband is operating a passenger transport business where most of the passengers are students going to and from their village to school in their town proper. Rowena is engaged in a typical village store business. She provides most of their daily basic necessities at home while some of her income was used to send her children to school. She is thankful for having her business beneficial to her family needs, and she hopes to sustain the business for their growing needs, especially when her two children go to college. Her dream is to become a successful businesswoman and give her children a better future someday. 

She is requesting additional business capital for her store from Kiva. She hopes to improve her business and sustain it for the future welfare of her children. She knows that being patient and working hard are the keys to a successful enterprise, thus Rowena keeps doing her best to able meet the standards in managing business.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Ayaba Viako

texts.fr: Cette dame est veuve et a à sa charge 03 enfants. Depuis la mort de son mari, il lui est difficile de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Pour cette raison elle s’est lancée en 2008 dans la vente de serviettes, de draps et d’habits à Lomé dans le quartier d’Agoè Sokpossito. Elle n’a plus de stock ; pour cela elle voudrait avoir un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 50 paires de serviettes, 10 paires de drap et 10 bals d’habits de seconde main de toute sorte.

loans.use: Achat de serviettes, de draps et d'habits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a freezer

loans.name: Mugoma Kweterana Joyce Baguma Kyawera Group

texts.en:
Joyce B. K. is a 50-year-old widow. She has four children, of which two are in school. She also has three dependents, all of whom attend school. Joyce sells fresh and dry beans. She has run this business, which shifts with the season, for over 10 years. 

Joyce wants to use this loan to increase the stock of beans she offers. Among other things, she wants to purchase three additional sacks of dry beans. She also hopes to purchase iron sheets for her house. Joyce is very hardworking and is a creative asset for her community. Her dream is to see prosperity come her way.

loans.use: To increase the stock of beans she offers.

loans.name: Oeun

texts.en:
Mr. Oeun T., age 43, and his wife, Mrs. Onn Bou, age 46, were married in 1988 and have five children: one daughter and four sons. Two of their children are in school and the other three are wooden-house builders. The family lives on an island in Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Oeun's wife is pictured in the photo. 

Oeun has been a wooden-house constructor for five years, while his wife stays at home to take care of their children and do housework. Their main source of income is only from his business. Oeun doesn’t have enough materials and wants to purchase more crane materials for operating the business, which is why he is asking for his first loan of $300. 

For their future plans, the couple hopes to support their children’s further education.

loans.use: To purchase crane materials for his wooden-house construction business

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn L. is from the village of San Juan, Gingoog City. She is 33 years old. Emelyn is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Emelyn makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling vegetables and snacks such as coconut jelly and rice cakes in the local community. Emelyn has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Emelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory, and as working capital. Emelyn is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Emelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies and to improve her current business.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: San Juan, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan L., 28, pictured with her husband, is married and lives with two of her children in the Takeo province. She and her husband are farmers; additionally, they make cow bells to sell at the local market. They typically make about US $2 each day. 

The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have made this a tough economic year for many Cambodians, Chan L. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US $800 to purchase materials and tools to make more cow bells. She is confident that this loan will allow her to increase her daily income and to better support her family.

loans.use: purchasing materials and tools to make more cow bells

loans.name: Nasim

texts.en: H. Nasim is married with 4 children. Given the lack of jobs and the difficulty of earning enough to support his family, ten years ago Nasim and his wife started their own business selling groceries. The quality of their service and daily efforts helped them retain customers. Nasim wants to boost his sales and therefore he is requesting a loan for 4000 Somoni to purchase merchandise. This is his fourth loan with IMON International. We look forward to more opportunities to assist him with his business. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of the foodstuff for increasing the range of goods for selling

loans.name: Ferdinand's Group

texts.en: Ferdinand V. is from the village of Alinam, Cauayan City. He is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Ferdinand is 42 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. He owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over ten years and earns approximately 20,000 every harvesting season. In 2008, Ferdinand joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be his fourth from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Valente Arrone

texts.pt:
Valente Arrone M. nasceu no Distrito de Bilene, Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique, tem 50 anos de idade, casado e pai de 5 filhos de 23, 21, 18, 13 e 11 anos de idade, destes o mais velho já não estuda. Licenciado em psicologia e pedagogia pela Universidade pedagógica no ano de 2008. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta um neto que vive com ele.

Saiu de Bilene para a cidade de Maputo, afim de continuar com os seus estudos, mais tarde começa a trabalhar no Distrito de Marracuene ainda na mesma província como docente. Exerce esta actividade a mais de 33 anos, faz um horário único das 7h as 12 horas e é do quadro do Ministério da Educação. Foi transferido para Boane onde veio a fixar a sua residência e vive neste local ate hoje. Tem um salário mensal de 12.900.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku quando passava em frente do escritório onde decidiu aproximar e se informar das condições de acesso a crédito. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 25.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (tintas, cimento, lava loiça, e portas interiores) para dar continuidade com a sua obra. O empréstimo anterior foi de 25.000.00mt para a mesma actividade.
 
 Futuramente gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para construir uma dependência no terreno da sua terra natal em Bilene Macia.
texts.en:
Valente Arrone M. was born in Bilene District, Gaza Province, in southern Mozambique. He is 50 years old, a married father of five children who are 23,21,18, 13 and 11 years old. The oldest child is no longer studying. Valente graduated from the teaching University with a degree in psychology and education in 2008. He lives with his family in his own house, and supports a grandson who lives with him.

He left Bilene for Maputo in order to continue his studies, and later started working as a teacher in Marracuene District. He performed this work for over 33 years and worked from 7am to 12 noon, following the Ministry of Education schedule. He was transferred to Boane where established his residence, and where he lives today. He earns a monthly salary of 12,900 MZN that he uses for household expenses while still saving some in his bank account.

He has never taken out a loan with another bank, and he learned about Hluvuku when he walked by their office and decided to learn more about the requirements for getting credit. This is his second loan in the amount of 25,000 MZN, with which he intends to buy construction materials (paint, cement, sink and interior doors) to complete his house. The previous loan was for 25,000 to do the same work.

In the future he would like to apply for additional loans in order to build a cottage on land in his home town in Bilene Macia.

Translated from Portuguese by David Kaisel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Las Divinas Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Divinas está integrado por Maribel P., Ría C. García, Orlando S. y Jenny del Carmen. Ellas son mujeres trabajadoras que desde temprana edad han tenido que salir adelante por sus familias.

Maribel P. inicio a vender ropa interior gracias a la ayuda económica que le dio su madre y luego con el tiempo empezó a trabajar en ADIM  lo que le ha permitido crecer. Mientras sus compañeros de grupo tienen comercializan otros productos Ría C. García tiene una fritanga un pequeño restaurante popular, Orlando S.  vende fresco y gaseosa y por último se encuentra Jenny del Carmen quien vende repuestos de bicicleta.
texts.en:
The Las Divinas group is comprised of Maribel P., Ría C. García, Orlando S., and Jenny del Carmen. They are hardworking women who, from an early age, have had to provide for their families. Maribel P. began selling underwear thanks to the economic help of her mother. Later, she began to work with ADIM, which has allowed the business to grow. Other group members have various businesses. Ría C. García has a “fritanga,” a small, popular restaurant. Orlando S. sells juice and soft drinks. And finally, Jenny del Carmen sells bicycle parts.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita F. is a 57-year old widow who lives in Brgy, Utod Pulupandan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by traveling to local markets to sell spices. She has six adult children and six grandchildren. Some of her children help her run the business.

Teresita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in the hope of improving her family's quality of life. Before her husband passed away she saw her family gradually raised from poverty. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD for her spice business, she now earns an average monthly income of Php 12,000. She is a member of good standing and is now borrowing Php 29,500 (her 18th loan) for her traveling spice business. Teresita is working hard to achieve her dream for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them "Dungganon"— a title of esteem that is bestowed on a community member who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: additional capital for business
